text: My favorite thai place in summerlin. Great service. Great price!!!
I love this restaurant and was surprised that they had one on this side of town. Came here for lunch with some friends and it does not disappoint despite the difference in location.
Good food, great prices. Most of the time I get theirs Lunch special, 2 items for 8$, and I have enough left overs for another lunch.

The food was good I ordered the ground chicken with basil .The service on the other hand was poor. The waitress seemed annoyed while taking our order I would have given this place four stars, but I really didn't enjoy the "overall" of the place because of the service.

Amazing! Fresh, tasty Thai food & it won't break your wallet! Great value, great portions. I originally ate at the restaurant in Chinatown & this food here at Noodle House 3 is just as great. Get some!

I usually like it here, but for the second time in a row now there was hair in my food. Not just one little tiny hair, but a long hair. I called to complain they weren't that apologetic. Disappointed and disgusted.

After being seated , it took our server 10 min. to take our drink order and this happened after I flagged him down.  After my family ordered everyone except my plate came out. They kept saying " so sorry " ! My family finished eating and I still don't have my plate ! As iam asking for the check , they finally bring out my food ! " so sorry " ! 
Si sorry for you Noodle House 3 ! Never going back again ! Lousy service !!

I was on my way home and I stopped at Smith's to pick up groceries, and in the parking lot I saw it.  The bright neon open sign was almost calling my name, that neon open sign knew I didn't want to go home and cook, it knew I wanted and needed fresh, fast, and quality Thai food. I ordered chicken Pad See Eu, OH MY!!! I was so good.  I soon invented reasons to be on that side of town to eat there, actually get take out from there.  As you read this review don't just think about going, experience it for yourself!!

Called for delivery. Friday night.... Soooo rude, the lady spoke almost no English, it was impossible for her to get our address right! WOWWWW
n I guess since they were closing at 10 and I called at 8:25 they did not want to deliver my food. 

they tried everything possible to NOT understand my order and then they said they had to charge me four dollars for delivery fee And the guy was insisting I pick up my order.  Then they hung up on me n my be.... Soooo

I called back after being hung up on n then they put me on hold for another 10 to 15 minutes. Is that how you treat YELPERS????
I won't n don't order from here they're very rude and they don't deserve your service and they will probably spit in your food when they do deliver your food finally after two hours. Mean horrible unprofessional. You won't be getting our 50$
Great food very authentic. Duck fried rice was very good. Tom yum soup was super good.

"Sorry you got sweet and sour sauce so you can't have any soy sauce."

Wow.
What kind of place restricts condiments THIS MUCH?

We've been coming here for 3-4 years and the customer service has always sucked but the last couple visits have just been extra horrible.
It's not even just this instance, it's just kind of the last straw because of how ridiculous it is?

It's honestly disappointing to see that repeat customers will always be treated worse with each occurring visit :)

edit: we have frequented this place much more then my check ins would lead you to believe. 
There was a period of time that we went every other day. That's honestly why this is so upsetting.
Supporting a local business is good and all, but not when they run their business like this.

Good job saving that 2cents on the packet of soy sauce (we just wanted one or two lol)
And thanks for giving us the sweet and sour sauce spilled all over the bottom of the bag.
That was very mature of you :)
Yum! Yellow chicken pumpkin curry and the dumplings are delicious!! Staff is always friendly and I eat/order from here on a daily basis. The inside is cute too.

Just stopped in for takeout. Ordered then noticed "C" rating. Place has been in steady decline since opening. East side facing Windows have tint half scraped off as it was a year ago. And graffiti still on those windows. Sorry to say, this is the last time we patronize this place.

I dined here a month ago and I remember feeling confused why this place had such high reviews. I asked 8/10 "hotness" on my dish and I got it. The taste, however was just average. This is your typical Thai food; I felt like the dish was just "going through the motions." The portions were smaller than what I'm used to getting from out of state Thai restaurants.

Pros: my dish was actually spicy
Cons: taste, portions, price
Been to this location a few times. Not impressed.  Food don't taste the same like other locations. So salty!

I would give them no stars if I could.  They had me wait 20 minutes before they told me that they forgot to put in my order.  But what they didn't forget was to ask me to pay first before forgetting to put in my order.  I was on my lunch break so i asked for my money back and had to go grab something else in a hurry.  They were not only unapologetic but tried to talk me out of canceling the order all together.   Just to add that they don't have call waiting so good luck trying to call ahead.  Needless to say that I will never come back here again.

Impressed with the food every time! There are a lot of options and the dishes can be made vegetarian/vegan! Will continue to eat here and I want to try take out as well. I ordered the Pad See Ew with tofu, vegan style! So delicious! Made with a soy sauce and broccoli. It was just under $7. I also ordered a side of steamed white rice. It was a decent portion for only $1.25. I recommend giving this Thai restaurant a try! They have two other locations as well but I haven't been to either one yet.

Love this little joint - especially since it's within walking distance from our neighborhood. 

 The food is fantastic. The service is great. The entire staff has always been friendly and helpful. We've tried a variety of dishes and they've all been tasty - including the Currys. The only caveat, is to be clear on your spice level.
NEVER DISAPPOINTS!!!!! Not only is the food terrific, the customer service and staff are the best.  If you are not a regular yet, once you go you will be part of the family.

Everyone here at Noodle House is awesome.
We are always happy to come and dine here the food is great and the service also. I always come for Thai Tea

I have been here quite a few times now. Both as dine in and take out. We have also frequented the Thai Noodle House on Wynn Road, but once we found out this was the same one but in the northwest we go here all the time. The prices are very reasonable ($8 or so a dish) and the flavor is the same. 

The decor at this location is much more modern and nicer than the original one in China Town i.e. this is casual date appropriate whereas the location in Chinatown would strike me more as meeting up with friends after having a few beers. Service has always been prompt and the food comes out quick. It has never been busy when we are here but I think that may just be lack of knowledge of this location. Which is good and bad, I like that it is not crowded and it is quiet but conversely I really want them to stay in business.  

I have tried quite a few things, but I always circle back to the Avocado and Salmon Panang. I love that they give a lot of sauce, because I like using my rice to sop up all the sauce and there is plenty to go around. I also get the duck curry quite often, but what can I say duck is almost always good. I always get the Thom Kai (same as Thom Kha Ka - please forgive me if I am not spelling this correctly). The meat, even the chicken, is tender - often times at other places, even at my favorite Lotus of Siam, the chicken is dry, more than likely from boiling the chicken in the broth, but I haven't had that experience here. 

This is a million times better than most cheap chinese places and the same cost as the prices are very reasonable. Although don't get me wrong, cheap chinese has its place in my little world too.  Not to mention they are in the same center as the German Bread Bakery - so if you time it right you could go to both and get morning pastries for the next day too!

This place was yummy! I'm always on the lookout for great Thai food, I feel like there are a lot of just mediocre places around Vegas. I randomly came across it online and saw that it was extremely close to my house so gave it a shot. I'm glad I did! I got food to go so can't review the dine in experience, though all the people I dealt with were very friendly. I got the green papaya salad which was delicious but VERY spicy. I usually get a 7 and did that here also. I'd say their 7 is most other places 10! I also got the panang avocado curry with shrimp. This was totally delicious and while still very spicy it was closer to what I  would consider a 7. (I am not a wuss when it comes to spice but my tummy was a'gurgling after this meal!) I will be going back for more soon now that I know it's in my neighborhood...but perhaps scaling back my spice number for once!
We order from this place all of the time. I've had their Seafood Combo Tom Yum, the Sliced Beef Soup, the Beef Combo Soup, Fried Chicken Over Fried Rice, and now their Duck Soup. Everything is great.
Such good Thai food and affordable too. Of course the pad thai is a classic and was delicious but we particularly loved the house tom yum!

Update The last few times I went the quality has gone down by a lot. I ordered Thai fried rice and it was pretty gross.Then I ordered Yellow chicken curry and the rice was crunchy and gross. I used to adore this place, but now I don't trust the food is fresh. Such a shame I literally ate there every weekend, but now I will never go back. I always read updated reviews because I realize restaurants can start to get lazy or staff changes and I never want to be a victim of poor quality food so I hope this review saves you from dissapointment.

Found this place here on yelp and my wife and I love it! Great food, but I've only had the Duck Curry because I'm hooked on it! My wife has had several noodle dishes and has loved them all...great place!
I've been to all their locations and this one is my favorite. The food is authentic tasting and prices are really good. Food also comes out pretty fast.
Great thai food at really affordable prices! Can't go wrong here my new spot for some really great soups and noodles.

Whether it's eat in or food to take out and eat at home this place is great!
From the Thai fried rice to the chicken noodle soup, yep Thai version, the flavors are on point! 
I've eaten from this restaurant for many years and it's always consistently delish!
Try it, you won't be disappointed!
I'm so glad I finally found a perfect Thai restaurant near summerlin area. Awesome food, clean and good service!!!!  Oh did I mentioned good $????

Great food! Be careful not to order too spicy!

I enjoy eating here. You can get a great meal for under 30 dollars for three

I am not a fan and probably will not return. 
The food didn't seem fresh. I've had thai basil leaf/spicy basil from almost 30 different places and this was the first time I've heard of string beans in this entree however I didn't think I'd mind since it's typically one of my favorite vegetables, but not this time; they tasted dry and dehydrated as if they were old and reused.  Half of the entree box was the entree [mostly vegetables, little meat (this is coming from a light meat eater)] and the other half was overloaded with rice. 
On the other hand they had a sign regarding a minimum spend requirement to use a credit card, but they still allowed me to use my card without a fee (at least I didn't see one snuck in there) which I appreciated.
Hope others have a better food experience than I did.

A very nice small restaurant. Pretty decor and spotlessly clean. Everything we have tried has been good. Lunch specials today. Mint chicken and sweet and sour pork, beef broccoli and Penang curry. You get soup, starter and 2 main dishes for $7.95. Amazing value.

By far the worst chicken noodle soup I have ever had in my life. The chicken didn't even look natural.. It was in like balled up chucks and the oily water broth tasted only of onion. I took 1 bite and was done.
Great food, great service I recommend the yellow curry and Kung Pao Chicken at Spicy level 8. Great taste!

Me and my boyfriend order two thai iced teas and we both got curry, mine with shrimp. The bill was 20$!! Such a good deal. The food portions were good size and also really delicious. Its kind a hole in the wall but definitely worth checking out and we will definitely be back!

Their other reviews are so good, maybe I came on a bad night.  But between us we ordered 2 salads and 2 entrees and only 1 of the 4 dishes was good.
We started with the Papaya Salad and Grilled Beef Salad.  The Papaya Salad was mediocre at best, but the Beef Salad was fantastic.  Bright, fresh flavors in the dressing and a nice char on the beef.
For entrees we had Duck Pad See Eu and Snapper Pad Ped Snapper.  The noodle dish was awful.  We each only took 1 bite.  It had a funny taste that in retrospect should have prompted me to send it back.  There was just something wrong, like old meat or oil that had me repulsed.
The fish itself was light and flaky inside, but the coating was a soggy mess.  It had been fried, then tossed in sauce, but the fried coating wasn't crispy enough so it just ended up with an almost gooey texture that was very unpleasant.
Service was good, but our salads didn't come out at the same time, then the entrees came within just a few minutes of getting the last salad.
Excellent food.  Large portions at affordable prices.  Very casual - not much ambiance.  Will definitely eat here again.

So I went in with my 3 kids and we been before I dnt know what happened this time we order our usually sticky rice n beef jerky and it sucked so bad the sticky rice was a disgrace it crumbled in our hands from being to wet or I dnt know what I couldn't eat my 3 hungry kids try to eat they crumbled everywhere as it was falling from there hands and it's suppose to be a hand meal I asked the worker she said supposed to be like that then 15 minutes later she tried to bring a new one when I ordered 4 witch it came out after the beef jerky at different times.....and said this one is free I said dnt worry it was insulting the rice was unedible we left hungry.....
Love this place I may have reviewed before but for the last year I have eaten here and it has remained just as good and affordable as day one!!! Also love how clean this place is!!!

Never had this type of food before, I loved it but the problem is service bad, not friendly at all. We were treated like we didnt belong there or an inconvenience. That's the only reason I give them 3 stars, the food's great.

Stunned by how good this place is!  I am a die-hard Le Thai person, but I have long needed a place where I can get my Pad Kee Mow fix both closer to home and open on Sunday.   Thai Noodle House nailed it.  We will be back.

Khuya Kai noodles are a tasty option. Great flavor and personable staff here at this location. This was my second visit to Thai noodle house and I was pleased. I got chicken this time & not shrimp like last time because the shrimp were dirty/not deveined....yucky! They have a delivery option too that is convenient. Thai tea here is liquid diabetes in disguise (fyi).

Thai Style Noodle House is my favorite Thai restaurant in the north west part of town and tied for my second favorite Thai restaurant overall (tied with Ping Pong and behind Lucki Thai). 

The service is always really good and the food comes fast, but is still prepared well.  

I have gotten a few different dishes but my go-to is Pad See-eu with chicken and a spicy level of 10. You get a generous portion of food and it is simply delicious. I also recommend the pot stickers.

There are other locations in Las Vegas (http://www.thaistylenoodlehouselv.com/), but I have only visited this one.

Food was okay. But the servers are kind of rude. So I asked one of their girl servers for a glass of water with ice, she ignored me. And for the second time, I reminded her about my glass of water with ice.. She raised her voice and said, 'yes i know i know'. LOL

good food and good priced. Its our go to thai place that is close to the house. They always serve good food and is inexpensive . We ate wonton soup and a radna and it came out to $16 for both of us. The portions are large and some dishes you end up taking home.
One of the best pho noodle places there is.  I definitely recommend anyone go there if you love noodle soup.

It was crazy, stupid delicious. I felt like I was betraying my favorite Thai restaurant in town cause this place has a spot in my heart now.

Was immediately greeted and seated as we walked in. She even put the sun shade down for the boyfriend & I since it was a little sunny. 1 Star!

Ordered our mandatory Thai Teas, in those large beer mugs. Truly appreciate the amount of ice, some places overload it and it gets watery. Sweetness was on point too. 2 Stars! 

Food came right after, Chicken Satay, Chicken Pad Thai (Spice level 6) & BBQ Pork over Fried Rice. Dear lawd, I almost blurted "Now THATS how it's supposed to be damnit!" So delicious!!! Chicken skewers had just enough spice and really complemented the peanut sauce. I even put the sauce in my pad Thai. And speaking of that Pad Thai, holy sssshhhhhh, it was everything & more. Spicy but tolerable. Noodles were so flavorful. Chicken was perfectly seasoned. Then the rice and pork BBQ was delicious! The man enjoyed the sweet chili sauce that comes with it while I enjoyed the sweet soy sauce. 3 Stars!

Ended the meal with Sticky Rice & Mangoes. It was really sweet, even the mango. Rice could be softer but I loved it anyway. 4 Stars!

Service was so friendly and quick too. Oh and the prices were so ridiculously cheap. 

And that leads me to 5 Stars! Can't wait to try their amazing lunch special too!
This was a terrible experience. I ordered to go. Pai thai, and Tom yum soup. The pai thai had no flavor the tom yum had weird imitation chicken.

At first, I was skeptical of trying this place because of their cheap prices. I was prejudice in thinking that it must not be good quality if the prices were this low. This is actually a solid Thai restaurant. Pretty good quality, very affordable and on most nights they deliver. Quite frankly it is the best valued Thai restaurant I've tried. Their portions are fairly generous as well. For the price you will not be disappointed.

My family tried this new Thai place at lake mead and Rampart, the food is excellent and the prices are great. The only bad thing about the place is the rest room is in the back of the restaurant since you have to walk outside  of the restaurant and then walk back to finish dining. But as far as the food and price is concerned it is one of the places that I would recommend. The food we ordered the taste and quality is great. This is definitely a place to go back for regular dining.

Had the Thai spicy noodle, it was baaaaad. I asked them for another dish to replace it and they had the chef come out and tell me it was my fault that it tasted "sour" because I put the red chili sauce on it. Obviously that was not the reason, but eventually they did replace it with the panang curry, which was delicious. My friend also had the spicy basil which was really good. Overall I was a disappointed in the service but selective dishes were good. Your call if you want to try this place out.

Thai Style Noodle House in Summerlin :) I have been going to their 2 other locations for over a year now and am glad they now have one closer to me! 

Great food! Good prices! Who can beat that!
I absolutely love their soups and the pot stickers are the best ever!
I'm a regular here.  Food is always fresh and prepared well. Can't go wrong with their noodle dishes. I ordered the duck fried rice and it was spectacular.

Good thai food.  We had pad thai and a lunch special (chicken).  The service was simple but attentive.  Since moving to Seattle we have missed good Thai and this was better than anything we have found in Seattle.  Price is very reasonable ... compared to prices on the strip it is a real bargain.  Atmosphere is basic diner style.

This place hands down is delicious, the ambiance is great it's located in a nice area and the restaurant inside is nice and clean. The staff is very friendly and welcoming as soon as you walk in. I will definitely return!

My family and I frequent here about 2 times a week and we love this place. Food is great and you can't beat the price. 

We usually order an array of dishes and share them. You can't go wrong with the chicken pad se-eu, chicken pot stickers are always crispy, spicy string bean chicken is definitely something worth trying, have a couple breath mints ready after having some chicken garlic and pepper, the panang curry is great; I can go on and on. 

Warning: they are generous with the spicy levels 1-10. I usually go with a 4 or 5. Sometimes I order a 6, and that can be too spicy for me, but I can handle it. My siblings can go higher levels! 

The service is great. Every single time that I have been there or called in an order, everyone has been so nice and accommodating.
The potstickers are amazing!!! Love the Pineapple Fried Rice and Pad Thai as well. Orders are always ready on time and quick when I place a pick up order!
Love this place. Good food and fair prices. The staff is friendly. The location is nice and clean. We eat here all the time and recommend it to everyone.

Okay, so I thought it would be super yummy ! Nah !..
It's okay.  Had the coconut milk with noodles 
Super pricey ! Didn't get a breakdown of charges 
Service SUCKS!!  Gave me my to go order and damm utensils or napkins. Not what I expected .... 
NO TIP for YOU !
My absolute favorite spot for authentic Thai flavors. The place is clean and the staff are always friendly.

Great place for a vegan and meat eater to go eat! Although beware... I ordered the veggie potstickers and they came with mayo on them.. When I asked the waitress if the mayo was vegan she was like "uhh... Yeah?". Don't lie! I have high doubts that this Thai restaurant has vegan mayo be, for this is not a vegan restaurant... Just so happens they have some vegan options. I would get no mayo if pure vegan and wanna get the potstickers. I always get the drunken noodle with fried tofu and that's amazing!!! Yum

Ordered delivery around lunch on Sunday. I love Thai and when I dine in I go to Nittayas secret kitchen and lotus of Siam, and everything I can in Chinatown. I live in summerlin and was looking for a go to delivery.  Horrible. Had such a craving for vegetable spring rolls and I bit into the first one and it was so salty I had to spit it out. Like ocean water! I tried another thinking it may have been accidentally dropped in salt but they were all inedible. Beef jerky? So salty. Pumpkin curry? So salty. Horrible. Threw it all out :(

I'm surprised this place has such a high rating. Walked in and didn't feel welcomed at all. The place was dirty and there were longs strands of hair everywhere.  I should've just left when I saw that, but I proceeded to order the Pad Thai. Of course, there was hair in the bag where my food was. The noodles were dry and clumped together. The beef tasteless, under seasoned and rough. It was just nasty. I will NEVER eat here again. 

I just threw the whole bag away after one bite!

The service sucked because the people that work there appeared to be rude. The food was just average for Thai food.  Kung fu on Valley and spring mountain is much better.  I will never be back at this place again.

I LOVE this place! Delivery Only. I have never dined in here, but every time I ordered they were always on time. 

I usually order their shrimp pad thai, thai ice tea, tom yum soup, their curry pineapple and shrimp with rice...It's sooo worth it, and of course their papaya salad. They are very nice, and for that they deserve a good tip. I highly recommend this place.
best tai food I ever had so far!  and ? price is awesome.  wish there is something like this in San diego

Friendly's staff, like family. Super reasonable prices. Though it's small the ambiance is wonderful. I can fill myself with wonderful Thai food , including food, drink and tip for less than 10 dollars.  How great is that!

This place only opened a few months ago, we've tried a few of their dishes! I can say everything we've ordered was very good! My sons favorite is their orange chicken and rice. Hubby loves their BBQ chicken with brown rice. I love their three companions plate with sticky rice and papaya salad with a little spicy. Their larb is excellent!! We order from them regularly! Service is great and they already know us! I haven't had a chance to try their deserts and drinks yet, that's next on my list. :)
Love this place. Good food, great prices and good service. Big portions too. Place is always clean. No complaints!

This is my go-to spot for good, authentic, and cheap Thai food, not to mention their portions are huge! I come here to order to-go and whenever my friends are in town. 5 stars for quality and for the bang for your buck! The staff is friendly, although quiet.

I always end up ordering the Tom Yum Noodle Soup with 7 spice level. It is so delicious and filling. I love how this dish comes with pork, shrimp, and fish cakes. It is like heaven in a bowl and great for cold days and hangovers (hah). Their basil fried rice and thai fried rice was amazing! I can't usually eat that many carbs in one sitting but I nearly ate the whole plate in one sitting. Like I said, each plate can yield about 2 meals (3 if you are a very light eater), so order accordingly. But hey, leftovers is never a bad thing either!

I hate being so negative, but this is for those who care about service and cleanliness, both of which were sorely lacking today. The chairs, for starters, looked like they were attacked by someone's pet lion. The floors looked like they might get mopped once a week with layers of dirt and footprints visible along with the added ambiance of strewn straw wrappers and gunk galore. The rectangular overhead vent was caked with visible dust. The windows were also filthy. The waitresses sat by the counter talking to one another through the meal, so I had to get up to ask for chopsticks and for more tea. That is not really the big deal, but a family of four came in after us and were seated at a filthy table that had not been cleaned off or wiped down before they were seated. If the place was buzzing, there would still be no excuse, but the place was just about empty. Instead of socializing and ignoring the customers, the help could have made sure the tables and the floor were clean. The shame of it is the food was very tasty, but I am grateful I did not see the kitchen.

I love Thai food and I know it well. I ordered pineapple fried rice and it came out like Chinese fried rice with pineapple in it. No curry, cumin , or anything that resembles Thai. My niece ordered Egg drop soup , and it tasted like dish soap and was very cloudy. My daughter ordered breaded chicken ( greasy and gross) My niece ordered yellow curry and was never asked how spicy  she wanted it. I will never go back to this place. I felt like I was in the Matrix dodging bullets. If you want real Thai check out Archie's. The waitress did try to give me something else, buying lost my appetite.

First-time review. I came here 30 minutes before 4pm and made it in time for their lunch special. It was a bit quiet when I first arrived, so I had no issues with service. For their lunch special, I ordered the panang curry with an egg roll and egg drop soup for under $6.

The egg drop soup was decent - it lacked a little flavor. The panang curry was delicious and I was able to taste the coconut milk with a little spice, but had more of a watery texture. I'm more of a fan of a thicker soup base with a lot more spice when it comes to curry, but they do give you the red chili flakes to add as needed. 

Overall, I like this place especially the price! I will be back!

A great place!! The chicken red curry is fantastic. The workers are so welcoming and helpful. I feel lucky that this is close to home, its easy for carry out and sitting in there is pleasant too. Excellent place check it out!!

Really nice place close by to my house .... friendly stuff the prices are not that bad, the food is good, it's a nice place to have something fast and good. I really like Thai food and happy to fined this place

Great value: Thai food for roughly $7/plate, and it's a big plate! I prefer take out rather than dine-in from here, but all the noodle dishes are solid options (beef pad see eu and chicken pad thai being staples), as winter rolls out I'll be ordering heavily from the diverse soups offered.
Service is polite, interior is surprisingly upscale if poorly maintained, and the pricing really can't be beat- especially for Summerlin!

They are always so nice and their food is delicious, good price as well. I usually order takeout but the inside of their restaurant is very cute and clean. Thanks people of Thai Noodle House for the delicious food!

I ordered a Thai beef salad to go that had good spice and balenced flavor but the beef was cut very thin and somewhat dry and the salad was a little lacking as well.  Prices were good and I will give it another chance sometime soon.

Great place for lunch and takeout.  Whenever I have a thai craving I text my friend and head here.  Love having such a great place in our area!  Love love love the panang curry...I dream of this stuff!  Spicey Eggplant is a another surprisingly tasty dish.  Potstickers are very good.  Pad thai can be very inconsistent.   Never had a bad dish here!  My only complaint would be the service...it's doesn't exactly come with a smile all the time. 

Don't know where to go for dinner/lunch?  Go here.  It won't break the bank and you'll leave with a full belly and a smile!

I work at the Mountain View hospital, and I am so glad I discovered Thai Style Noodle House.

I order lunch from Thai Style Noodle House probably once a week. They are as reasonably priced as any other lunch establishment and I have yet to be disappointed by the food they deliver. 

I can honestly say that their pot stickers with their special sauce on top are the BEST I HAVE EVER HAD. I also usually get either the chicken pad thai or the yellow curry. Both are always pretty good, I wish however they would provide me with a larger container for my curry. They fill the container to the rim with the delicious curry leaving me no room at all for my rice. I always end up using my own bowl to make due.

On two occasions they did have a delivery driver available. I ended up going to pick up the food and felt so much better knowing my food was coming from a really clean place. 

Thai Style Noodle House is a perfect spot for some tasty Thai food.

Such good lunch specials!  You get a decent portion and it tastes delicious.  I usually get pad see ew and it is always on point.  

A very good affordable place with quality food.

So sorry people expect a smile when you walk in - Really??  It is about getting consistent food, service and inexpensive.  This is not top shelf, however it is great for consistency.  Cooks change, however the recipe are the same - KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK.
Good but not great Thai food. There aren't that many even good Thai places in Summerlin, so I will be back

This was my 1st time here, and the Customer and was great! There is a guy named Night, and he was awesome. Being new to Thai food He answered my questions with patience, and even made some suggestions. I ordered a Thai tea, yellow curry, and pad Thai with steamed tofu. Portions are good, and food was good. I will come back for the customer svs!
Simply the best Thai restaurant in Summerlin and possibly in town! Great prices, fast service and delicious food.

A great Thai place for it's cheap price, and yet authentic cooking. I ordered Panang Beef and PadThai, both were delicious. I wish it's closer to my house so that they can deliver to me. I'll definitely be back!

Ok Thai food. First the place looks nice, design of the restaurant is modern and comfortable. The servers are average, nothing outstanding nor poor. They seem like they just want to get people in and out, I guess there's nothing wrong with that.

Tried the chicken Satay. Nothing special, just chicken breast on sticks. No real flavor profile. The crab fried rice was salty. The Tom yum noodle was pretty good; nicely sour with just the right amount of spicy. The fried chicken was overdone; therefore a bit dry. The Thai ice tea was very good. Most places is too sweet; it was perfect here. Thus earning three rather than two stars.

Mmm, Thai food.  We have a casual dating-kind of relationship going.  I can go for awhile without it, then all of a sudden have a craving that simply can't be fulfilled.  By no means am I married to one Thai place, but my favorite is still probably the one by my house.

Don't be confused, though - I still enjoy this place every now and again.  We've spent some pretty good time together.  I've actually eaten here a few times but usually I get delivery to my job.

The pad see ew is absolutely delicious - the flat noodles are nice and well-cooked, tossed with a delicious sauce, chicken and plenty of vegetables (but not too many that you feel like you're getting stiffed).

The red curry I had when I was super-congested - I believe I ordered a 5 or a 6 (their spicy scale is 1-10) - and not only was it, too, tasty, but it also allowed me to breathe with its well-placed spiciness.

The pad thai is good and reminiscent of the pad se ew but I felt it lacked a little flavor as I really enjoy that in-your-face peanut sauce that, to me, is a staple of the pad thai dish.  It had a hint of a lemon flavor, which is the biggest reason I dislike the pad thai from Le Thai, but it wasn't enough to completely turn me off to the dish.  Or maybe I was starving that day.  I don't know, but it was gone pretty fast.

Each time there's certainly been enough for two meals (I just happened to really be hungry on the pad thai day) and the prices are quite reasonable.  Delivery time can vary - once I waited almost an hour while another time it was around 20 minutes.

Give it a first date - you may end up going for a second.  =)

It used to be my favorite restaurant but not anymore after what I had today. Pineapple fried rice was so wet and plain. They used to have good pad see eeu but this time it's so plain and has almost no flavor to it. Pad Thai was so dry I feel like I'm eating old food. I'm so disappointed!!!! Time to find a new Thai restaurant!!!!

I don't think that it quite lived up to the hype...might have been because I ordered take-out or ordered the wrong thing? I got the Drunken Noodles and it was incredibly greasy...It also tasted a bit bland...Also wasn't the most authentic.
Maybe their noodle soups are better? I do have to say that it is very affordable, though.

We enjoyed this restaurant for years but, as others have reviewed, it has gone downhill over the past year. The last time we dined here the establishment was nearly empty (on a weekend) and the floors, tables, and walls were filthy. The food has become overly oily and salty despite requests for less of both. The service was exceptionally poor, too.

Thai Style Noodle House in Summerlin is amazing, really. My friends and I have been going there at least once a week (sometimes as many as 3 times a week) and every item we have ordered has been fresh, full of rich and varied flavors, and simply addictive! Should mention we all eat Paleo most of the time and there is lots on this menu for Paleo or gluten free eaters. 

All the curries are great, our favorite remains the avocado/salmon (or shrimp) which we get them to add broccoli to as we require lots of vegetable intake. Also recommend the Chicken Satay, Ginger Snapper and do not miss the Pineapple Fried Rice which has such a special flavor. I have never been a fan of eggplant but do not miss the eggplant on this menu, it will blow you away! 

The prices simply cannot be beat. This is high quality cuisine at a truly reasonable price. 

As for the spot itself, could use some better lighting, it is just exceptionally bright. The tables are clean, the chairs really comfortable, and staff is always friendly and really knows the menu. You have to go outside to get to the bathroom around back but it is very clean. If you order take out be very careful in transport as some items are too much liquid for their take out boxes. 

Love it!

I think the original location is waaaay better. Had a decent selection during lunch time: beef pad see eew, combination beef noodle soup and spicy basil eggplant with tofu. My family and I originally went for the soup. I'm glad we got the two other dishes cause the soup was very lacking in flavor. The meat was dry and not tender. Pretty disappointed cause I had been craving Thai noodle soup for weeks. Service was alright, nothing real good and nothing real bad about it.
Fell in love with the Tom Yum soup!  Cute place, friendly staff, fast and inexpensive-
Love this place! Best Thai food I've had since moving to Vegas. Personal fav is steamed ginger snapper.

Roasted duck curry for $8, you have to be kidding.  We have not gone back to any of the neighborhood Chinese take-outs since this location of Thai Noodle opened.   Their prices are extremely reasonable for the quality of food.  If you go to any one of their locations be sure and try the salmon and avocado panang, original and a great balance of flavors.

A best kept secret! The Panang Avocado flavor blew us away. Potstickers with 3 sauces are a good pick. Shrimp Pad Thai is the best we've had in Vegas. Prices ? CHEAP!
Beer and wine license is in the works. You can bring your own bottle if you buy it have the receipt with you.

Hit up Thai Style on the way home from taking the bus to LA - ordered up veggie egg rolls, my beloved Pad Ped Snapper, Thai Spicy Noodles and the Three Flavor Salmon - all at a 6 or so heat. The egg rolls were, again, sizzling hot and perfectly done - crispy on the outside with soft veggies on the inside.  The Noodles hit the table next - ALMOST too spicey-hot - but that really means just right. The Pad Ped was a disappointment.  A completely different preparation from the last time we had it - the breading was not thick and crunchy, but more like a light dusting of fine panko and swimming in a thin sauce (last time it was more like a paste). Don't get me wrong, this is still a great dish - just completely different from what I had experienced prior.  I had a bite of the Three Flavor Salmon - which seemed really nice and complex.

I got the green curry and it was delicious, but I ordered it a few levels too spicy and couldn't handle it lol. Totally my fault, not theirs. 

Our server was extremely nice and made conversation with us in between orders. The restaurant looks a little dated but it's clean. 

Try the Thai tea- it's perfectly sweetened without being overly so. 

Nice little spot to get my Thai food fix!
We ordered the Sliced Beef Noodle Soup with egg noodles and Crab Fried Rice to go. Meat was a little tough but otherwise, great food! Very plentiful!

Very solid 3 stars for me. Ordered the Penang curry which was very tasty and perfectly seasoned. The pad Thai was kind of on the sweet side for me. The pineapple fried rice was just whatever, it wasn't like OMG or anything. Kind of plain, IMHO. I would come back for the Penang curry though!
Tastes good but be careful. I ordered my food 3/10 spicy level. But it was so spicy it upset my stomach. Soups are good. And fried rices have good combination of flavors.

I don't feel that the food is very authentic or at least not the way I am used to. I've had most of the things on the menu and the only things I like are the soups, basil fried rice, sticky rice, and papaya salad. All of the entrees I've had were weird and not prepared anything like I've traditionally had, plus they give a huge amount of rice per entree and in the same container so the rice gets all soggy. For the price the soups are a good value but everything else isn't because I don't feel that it's edible. The meats are always a weird texture, almost like they used canned meat or something like in the garlic pepper chicken, ginger chicken, even the fried chicken which has rave reviews was a weird orange and also soggy. How do you serve soggy fried chicken?? I've had more entrees and also ones with beef which weren't to my liking. The only things I have liked didn't have meat in them or had tofu. I'll still come here for the soups and basil fried rice, but nothing else.

UPDATE:
Gave this place another try and it was even worse than before. With all the options out there and much better customer service elsewhere I won't ever be coming back. Disgusted by the workers here....

The food was some what good, service sucks. We order four soup bowls one rice plate a salad and two appetizers. The appetizers arrived first thing rice plate ten min later with a soup bowl and salad. We got two soup bowls fifteen min after and never saw the fourth soup bowl. But she still wanted to charge us for it. Note they still charge their 20% gratuity for six people!!

This is a cute little hole in the wall place. I'm personally not a huge fan of Asian food BUT their stuff is GREAT, and a good price. The inside seating area is real nice and it's a good place enjoy a good meal.

Tom Yum Goong is my favorite Thai soup. The ones I have tried at the last few Thai restaurants were not satisfying or just disappointing. When I saw that they have Tom Yum seafood noodle, I was intrigued since I haven't had it with noodles and seafood other than shrimp before. 

They have an option of four different noodles. I chose the flat, wide rice noodles. The broth was so satisfying and flavorful. I went with spice level 5 which turned out to be just the right spice level. I loved it with the noodles, fish cakes, squid, etc. After I finished my soup, I already knew I would be back for this delicious, hearty, satisfying soup.

My father works in the area, and after his own ravings, I had to try Noodle House.

When entering, the front room appears to be dirty, or, at least, the windows do. The tables, chairs, yadda yadda are all pretty good. (Honestly? Asian places are best when they look kinda dirty.) But don't let that deceive that.

The food? Pretty darn good. I personally had a bowl of Tom Kha, otherwise known as Tom Yum with coconut milk. The chicken was of good quality, although the amount of mushrooms definitely left me wanting more. The broth had a great taste, and for the value, the dish was massive. However, that's also it's downfall. While the broth was rich and great, I couldn't bring myself to finish it. Because of it's large amount, the broth by itself is a bit rancid and difficult to eat without any other ingredients, mostly because of its silky smooth texture.

My sister had the Appetizer sampler, complete with the great chicken kabobs, well made crab rangoons, typical egg rolls, and sadly disappointing fried tofu. It was too thin and dry to properly eat.

My favorite dish, however, were the flat Thai spice noodles. The beef had a succulent taste, and the fried noodles were delicious and melted in your mouth. It may have been one of the best thai dishes I had ever had -- even the amount of spice was perfect!

The value alone makes Thai Style Noodle House a must visit. While the rest of their Thai dishes are certainly great, I'll definitely be coming back for the namesake.

Stay away from this place. The management is very rude. Gf ordered the beef noodle soup,and ask if it had a lot of vegetables in it.The waiter said yes. When we got the bill they added a dollar more to the price! All this without informing of the extra charge! And the beef was so tough she couldn't eat it! When we made the complaint to the manager she ignored us and didn't even apologize! Food is not as expected. Noodles were overcooked. The people are not customer oriented. We are not going to come back. First time here and the last! 
.

Quick easy and so so tasty. This place has to be my favorite restaurant. The vibe is very laid back the staff is incredibly friendly, the prices are unbeatable and the food is amazing.  I usually get the pad see eu, pad Thai, and sticky rice, their Mongolian beef is really good too. My dad usually gets the soups here and he loves them all. I highly recommend anyone to try this place if you're in need of a new Thai restaurant.

This best food in Las Vegas!

I am planning my day for tomorrow and deciding when I am going to fit Thai Style Noodle House into my schedule.

Best soup ever, but I am going to try something new.  No doubt it will be the highlight of my day.

Just went yesterday and the food was pretty good. However the ambiance wasn't very welcoming and the service wasn't very good. The people didn't bring even bring us napkins and they never checked up on us. It seemed like they had an attitude, but could be because we got there late. I got the Thai chili noodles I think which were really good and the 5 level of spiciness was perfect.

This review is on service alone. We felt as if we were bothering the servers. They were chatting the whole time, sitting at a table for 2. We were the only guests in the restaurant and we had to interrupt their conversation for a refill of iced tea and then another time for our bill.

Called and placed my order. Was told told it would be ready in 15 minutes.  I arrived 10 mins after I called and waited 20 more mins. People came in  after me were seated and got there food. When I finally received my food and took it home it was cold. Never going here again. And not to mention the fried wonton was fried so hard I could barely eat and. And nothing was inside of them .

I ate at this place as a regular, and used to order delivery from their Chinatown location more often than I'd like to admit since 2011 or 12. Back then, my review would be 4 or 5 stars.

Then came the day where they put big ol hunks of CHICKEN in my vegetarian spicy eggplant with fried tofu!!!! And now, I just literally can't even...

So if you are veg inclined, do exercise caution.
Like this restaurant very special love the food this is the second time i been here I will recommend this place

The food is ok.... I order red curry at a 7 and it is NEVER hot as I like..... also if you are in there either the day before or after a "holiday" they DO NOT offer the lunch special.  We went the day after New Year's day and they said it was still a holiday.... I said well technically it is not a holiday.  oh well

As for so many other incredible "gem" finds, I have a trusted Yelp bud to thank for this one. Feeling under the weather a few months ago and craving spicy soup, I turned to my foodie Jedi Master, Kevin P for sage (and nearby) wisdom. Of course, he knew that this Chinatown staple had opened in our hood. Shares a car park with Smith's/German Bread Bakery, etc @ Rampart and Lake Mead. 

They do deliver, but a GF was kind enough to bring me spicy noodle soup (ordered 10/10 was more Ike an 8, but hit the spot) Like the original, they are known for their duck and it is an add on in many dishes; carnivore friends love it, not my thing. Drunken Noodles are a favorite and tasty and their curries are delicious. Really love that they inquire if you are vegan when you ask a dish to be prepared meat free and their willingness to change dishes for those of us who have restrictions. 

The value cannot be overstated: you easily get two meals from every portion here without compromising great taste. The decor is pretty, service is charming and on point and by now we all know the restroom is outside. Dining in is a lovely experience as the dying art of customer service with a smile abounds here. 

Over the course of several months, we've  ordered them in for Board Meetings, spontaneous gatherings and take and go a half dozen times. Everyone is equally astonished at location, quality and ROI. 

Almost glad to have had whatever the strange malady was which haunted my first week or so of year, as Kevin directed me to a clearly outstanding and unassuming place I'll continue to patronize and suggest to others. Now that they know me, I get my 10/10 spicy level and more. Welcome addition to the hood fo sho!

Yelp 100 Challenge

Just went for my first time. Food is amazing! Prices are fair too. Just wish I was treated better. The lady who helped me was rude and decided to help other customers behind me before even greeting me. If it weren't for that, I would have given five stars. Knocked off two stars because I was so offended.

This is a take out sport for sure. I wanted to sit down and they tried to sit us at the table the worker had been sitting at playing on his cell phone. When I asked if they had something away from the door because it was very cold, they said that they had already closed the dining side(more than two hours before closing). He sat us away from the door but then we had a bout five different servers come over and try and take our order when we had barely looked at the menu. We were kind of rushed. When our food came out my boyfriend tasted mine and said "this has an interesting flavor, but I don't want to tell you what it is(he knew I'd send it back or not eat it) a few bites in I figure out that they had burnt my food and scraped it out of the pan as I found the "char" and saw black pieces floating around in my noodles. I just paid and got out of there. I will never be back.

Dinner Total With Tax: $20.40 - Very cheap! 

We ordered: 
1. Pad thai with chicken (with spicy #8) $6.75
2. Pad see-eu / pad see ew with beef (with spicy #7) $6.75
3. Vegetarian egg-rolls (4 pcs) $4.95

Taste: 3 stars - Our takeout pad thai was on the dry side - we prefer our noodles moist and juicy! On the other hand, our pad see ew was cooked very well, the noodles were moist and the beef was tender. Yet, both noodle dishes were lacking much salt and sweetness. We were expecting bold, vibrant, Thai flavors, but instead the flavors of the noodle dishes fell flat. I favored the moist pad see ew over the dry pad thai. The veggie eggrolls were crispy, but sadly not stuffed to the max with veggies. However, their homemade sweet and sour sauce was amazing! I would order extra sauce next time. 

Value: 5 stars - Wow! 2 dinner portions and an appetizer was $20! They were generous, even on takeout orders. They didn't skimp on any of the noodle dishes, lot's of meat and lots of noodles. It's hard to find decent local food on a bargain budget, but here it is! 

Service: 5 stars - The lady was very friendly over the phone and she also gathered up thai bird chilies in fish sauce and jalapeños in vinegar for us, as we requested. Even though we were the last customers in the door for the evening, she was still happy and helpful. 

Spice levels: 2 stars - Not very spicy. The spicy levels here are not true to taste. We ordered the pad see ew with spicy #7. In all honesty, we both felt that it was not a true 7, and more like a spicy #2. It wasn't spicy at all. We could of easily asked for a spicy 10 and enjoyed it. We also tried the pad thai with spicy #8, yes, it had minor heat, but more like a spicy #5. It wasn't spicy enough for us. (Note, we are avid spice fans. We love the burn!)

Would we eat here again? Oh hell yus!! Nothing a little salt can't fix.

You cannot beat their lunch specials Monday-Sunday 11-4pm.  Two entrees, soup, appetizer for under $8.00.  I had the yummy mint chicken and spicy eggplant with eggdrop soup and fried tofu - great stuff!  They have extended their dining area and updated the decor since they first opened.  Check it out!

Add this restaurant to the list of Vegas Yelpers gone wrong.  I understand that Las Vegas isn't exactly a foodie destination (outside of several restaurants on and around the strip).  Thai Style Noodle House is no exception.  My party had the following: Mongolian beef, beef and broccoli, spicy string beans and pork, crispy noodles with seafood gravy.  Sweet, sweet, sweet, with a bit of MSG.  White seats with faux (?) leather all look dirty and our table top was sticky.

One star for the price as this is considered to be cheap Asian food.  

My advice: Head over to Nattaya's Secret Kitchen across the street.  You'll pay more but you'll get much better food.

Phenomenal Thai-style take-out place. Took less than 10 minutes between placing the order and leaving the restaurant; amazing speed and service for the quality of the food. Chicken Fried Rice, Chicken Green Curry, and Tom Kha Soup are a few of our favorites from Thai Style Noodle House.
Absolutely best Thai food on Vegas! Great menu reasonable prices. Staff friendly, happy and attentive. This is a great place to have dinner. Will be back often

Ordered to go through a good deliver site. This place is really good and has great prices. We got yellow curry and Pad Ped Snapper. Unfortunately the curry portion is a little small but both meals tasted amazing. We'll be ordering from here again for sure

Excellent food and always welcoming of ingredients changed to your order. The Tom Ka coconut soup is outrageous. I can't say how much better this Thai restaurant is compared to others, that all depends on personal preferences, but I can say this place gets the highest score possible from me because of their amazing menu, great chef, and excellent options when I order delivery. Now that the Rampart construction is finished I can get to Thai Noodle House in a hop, skip, and a jump. You have just got to go and try it for yourself! You wont be disappointed!
Just meh....maybe dine in is better, but the take out was our first and last time ordering.

Best Thai Food I've had, hands down. I always get it to go, I haven't dined in the restaurant before. I get the Basil Beef and the Chicken Pad See Ew with the Veggie Egg Rolls. I'm a giant baby when it comes to the spicy levels so I always get a 3 and that is usually more than enough spicy for me. The portions are large. The above order is more than enough for my boyfriend and I. The people working are always extremely friendly and it never takes more than 15 minutes to make our entire order. I've never had to wait for anything when I've gone there. 

I can't recommend this place enough!

Great food and prices. 

Willing to accommodate my vegan diet. 

Great service and portions are very generous. 

On the spice level, five is too hot. Stay at number three.

Added bonus if you belong to the American Airlines advantage dining program. You get miles for your dollars spent here. 

Will definitely come back and recommend.

The food is amazing, the prices unbelievable, and the service was quick and friendly.   The atmosphere is laid back and beautiful. We had 2 appetizers, 4 entrees, 3 drinks and a dessert for $51!  And every single thing was delicious.   The potstickers were yummy.  We're already talking about when we're going back. 

Give this place a shot.  Your taste buds and your wallet will thank you.

This place was an unexpected gem and recommended especially for those who live in the area.  We had the Guay-Teaiw-Loard, seafood aoup, and pad Thai along with fried banana for dessert.  The portions were fairly big and the food overall was quite tasty.  For a chill atmosphere and family-sized portions, check this place out.

First time for everything.  Interior is pretty nice, for a grocery store shopping center location, its on the corner of Lake Mead and Rampart, but the big Smiths Shopping store, opposite end from the grocery store.   Its on the NW corner.   It was slightly tricky to find.   I asked the 'owner' I assume for her favorite thai soup, she recommended her version of the tom yum, I got it with extra fish balls and spice level 5, since my gut is killing me lately, but I was fine after I slurped this yummy goodness down.  The fishballs tasted and had the texture of scallops, I was amazed, that was a surprise. the rice noodles inside a tom yum broth with some chilis and chili oil flowing over the abiss of broth, fish balls(ASK FOR THIS!) and little bits of meat and shrimps.  My buddy had the Chix Noodle Soup and he said it was the best he has ever had.  I had to ding em up on the service.  Its seat yourself and the girl running the place, seemed very stressed out.   She was there with I needed her, barely, we had to get our own napkins once we slammed are faces into the goodness, but that's elementary for a restaurant, bring me a napkin.  Also, my buddy asked for rice and meat and she had no recommendation, she was silent, maybe it was a language barrier.  A host or something would have helped the whole service standard.  Still, the place has a great atmosphere, they are pretty fast too, and the food is different and very tasty compared to the 100+ thai places I have been too, I will go back again and again....Phob gun Reaw-reaw nee khrup ---translation --See You soon!

Pad thai is yummy! Also obsessed with the pineapple fried rice and the pineapple curry with shrimp! Always a go to when I'm looking for something super yummy and quick or  a last minute carry out order

The interior was nice and clean. I ordered some Papya salad and sticky rice, along with beef combination noodle soup. Everything was delicious! I wish that our server came back more often to offer to fill our drinks, but it was pretty busy. Everyone was friendly and the price was great! Will definitely visit again.
My favorite place to eat right now. Always get the same thing and im always happy. Only complaint is i wish they had a location closer to alliante area.

The last two times my order to go has taken way too long. 30 minutes and just today 40 minutes. I saw people that ordered after me get theirs first. And tonight one of their excuses was "they called before you came." Well I would've called also if you actually answered your phone during the 10 minutes I was trying to reach someone. After 40 minutes I asked for a refund so I could leave and get food somewhere else. The lady went to the kitchen instead of giving me my refund and oh my food just happened to be ready. 
Neither of those times was the place even halfway full. 
If you're debating on where to go for Thai food go somewhere else.

One of my favorite Thai places in Vegas, especially if I am looking for authentic soup. The location is tiny, and easy to miss if you are not looking for it. No special décor, no dress code. Just real Thai food at it's finest, served by people who know what they are doing. 
For appetizers, I love the chicken satay, crab rangoons, and their special style of pot sticker, that is not like your classic gyoza at all. They offer Tom Kha, or Tom Yum, with or without noodle, and you also get to choose between 4 types of noodle. Also, they will totally accommodate special requests. I ordered regular chicken noodle soup, and they made it Thai spicy per my request. 
My daughter loves the pineapple fried rice, and gets it every single time we go here. Its a mix of shrimp and chicken, and is not spicy like other dishes.
Level 8 is my go to. It's almost unbearable, but still has tons of flavor. 
My boyfriend loves the garlic and pepper entrée with chicken, and a fried egg. 
You can get this as a lunch special as well, smaller portion but at a great price! He gets a level 5 or 6, and its just a tad spicy. Average, if you can't handle it, you shouldn't be eating Thai food! 
The curry is also a safe bet, I prefer yellow or panang. Pretty large portions with the dinner, I had to ask for extra rice. 
I have never once dined here and not been totally satisfied with my meal, the service, the pricing, and my overall experience. I eventually will step out of my normal routine and try something new!

This place is filthy!  The windows are disgusting!   YUK!!   WASH YOUR WINDOWS INSIDE AND OUT, THAI STYLE!!  WIPE OFF YOUR FILTHY MENUS - THERE ARE FOOD DROPPINGS INSIDE.  YUK!  WIPE OFF YOUR CHAIRS - THERE ARE FOOD DROPPINGS ALL OVER THE CHAIRS.  What is your kitchen like if you are this filthy in the eating area?  Unfortunately, dirty Thai/Asian restaurants like this give ALL Asian restaurants a bad name.

Old rice is served, too.  My husband ordered Sweet and Sour Chicken and there was no chicken, just batter on skin.  Ewww.  Very disappointed, we used to love this place.  Either they need a new manager, or they will go out of business.  Waiters are not friendly, either.  

PLUS, the bathroom is located out in the back alley!!  You have to go outside, like at an old fashioned gas station.  How do the employee's wash their hands?????

YUK!!  This place needs sanitizing!!  The Health Department needs to visit this place and issue some citations.
Food is always to satisfaction, better throughout the week than on weekends. I CRAVE their soups!!! A must try, at least once.

Yummy and deliciously spicy!!! We order tum yum soup (chicken), papaya salad and Thai beef ball noodle soup all were soooooooo gooood!!! Would recommend to anyone who loves spice and flavors. Service was quick and meal prep was fast. Reasonable price.
Fantastic Thai food off the strip!

I've eaten at  just about every thai place in town literally  and this is my favorite, the prices are awesome the portions are very generous and most importantly the food is amazing. Not a single bad experience here. I eat here about twice a week. Wish i can give 6/5 stars

I love this place. I love that it is so very close to where I stay. The food is great and the restaurant itself is really quite charming in decor. Very rarely do I find an affordable place with more then half a dozen items on the menu that I would consider superb. From the coconut chicken soup to the pad thai and beef noodle classics to their signature and quite possibly my favorite dish here, the pad ped  snapper. Seriously, for under ten dollars you can get a warm, delicious thai delicacy, served quickly, with a smile. This place is perfect to meet up at for a quick lunch or to order take-out on the way home. Especially now that the weather is getting cooler again, I'm for sure looking forward to taking home some of their amazing soups and comforting stews.

We liked it. It definitely does not deserve a 4 or more, though.

The inside is nice, clean, and modern. We weren't expecting that, especially after we saw the prices. Dishes were mainly around $7.95-8.95, which we thought were more along the lines of fast food prices. The portions, however, were remarkably small. You get what you pay for I guess.

We started off with a papaya salad, at a spicy 8/10. For some reason the portion we got was very very little, compared to some yelp pictures I checked online. Even the cabbage was just a small hunk, but when I asked for more, they were very accommodating.

We got some sort of veggie stir fry flat noodle, which was good, but could've been better. The vegetables in it weren't great, the carrots were sliced too thin, and the portion was again, too small.

The last thing we got was our least favorite. It was a seafood pancake, which I expected to be kind of like the ones you get a Korean restaurants, so I was curious about the Thai version. It was seriously lacking in the seafood, way too much starch or whatever they mixed it with so as a result kind of bland, and FAR too oily. I don't rarely blot food with napkins, but I did so in this situation. Also not a fan of the bed of stir-fry bean sprouts it came on, I think raw would've been more authentic? Just my two cents.

All in all, we really wanted to like it, we kind of liked it, and we hope that in the future they give bigger portions. We both agreed we could've gotten a fourth dish, which shouldn't be the case with any restaurant to feel full unless it's tapas.
Love there food here..so yummy and great prices not so expensive..fried ice cream is always a must for me here for dessert so good

One of my fam's favorite Thai restaurants in Vegas. Their food is very authentic and contains awesome flavors. They have several locations as well. Their main one is in the Chinatown area on Spring Mountain.

I looove spicy food so I'm always up for trying places that specialize in spicy dishes. Thai and Laotian foods are known to have a lot of heat, and if you're like me, this place would be a yummy choice!

Pro-tip:
-Some orders may be served in A La Carte portions, so make sure to ask for this if you plan on sharing dishes with a group!

Faves/Recommendations:
-Panang (Curry)
-Tom Yum (Soup)
-Khua Khai (Noodle dish)
-Pad See Ew (Noodle dish)

Finally some solid thai food near the crib. Rampart and Lake Mead....In my opinion it crushes Jasmine Thai and Pin Kaow in this vicinity. A few more impressive visits will constitute some 5 star action.....UPDATE: 5th STAR earned do to continuous awesome food! The wifey and I have tried multiple dishes on their menu and have been impressed with them! Tom Ka Goong, Tom Yum Goong, Duck noodle soup and Seafood Tom Yum Noodle soup with Rice noodles are a few of our favorites. Great for kids also!

LOVE this place! I just moved back to Vegas and I'm in search of a great Thai place. My husband and I stopped in last night (Saturday) at the recommendation of a coworker who lives in the area, and we really enjoyed the food - this is definitely a solid place for a good Thai dinner!

It's a cozy, welcoming place - very modern decor, with two different seating areas - we asked to be on the left side of the restaurant since nobody else was there, which they had no problem with. Someone came over quickly to get our drink order, and we put our dinner order in at the same time since we generally order the same thing every time we have Thai - chicken tom kha soup to share, chicken pad thai (me) and chicken thai fried rice (him) - all at a 6, or 7 if we really feel like punishing ourselves. 

Our food came out quickly. Portions are a perfect size - there was enough tom kha for both of us to have a couple bowls and take home a serving for leftovers - husband finished all of his fried rice, but I had plenty of pad thai leftover. The food was delicious - very fresh and at the perfect spice level! Very flavorful. Their tom kha soup had more of a sweetness than we are used to, but it was so good - a welcome change. 

At the end of our meal, someone else came around to check on us and make sure we liked our dinner and to ask if we needed anything. We didn't ever feel like we were waiting for service here, even as they started to get busier. Last thing to mention - prices are very reasonable. I think our bill was just over $20. I love this place and can't wait to come back!

This is me and my brothers' go-to Thai place, specially since it's so near our house and they're open late (I think 'til 11pm everyday) They have really good food. I haven't had anything from there that I didn't like. I love the combo beef noodle soup and their bbq over rice entree as well as their green curry. I got tofu and the yellow curry with pumpkin and chicken for the boyfriend who is Arab and never had Thai food before and let's just say he couldn't stop raving about it that he had to go get more curry from them the next day :) The staff are very friendly as well, even tho we would always go there late at night. I love that their food is pretty authentic, having experience Chef McDang's (Thailand's only Celebrity Chef) cooking first hand during his demonstration in our school. I'd definitely go there every time I crave for Thai food and would recommend to others :)
Clean. Fast and friendly service. The panang avocado with shrimp was delicious!  Will dine here again.

We order from this place 1-2 times per week and I would eat here more often if 
we could afford it. The food can be somewhat inconsistent 
(maybe because we always order delivery or takeout) but its almost always great. 
I love the pad thai (6), it's one of the best I've ever had, and the orange beef,  
which I don't even think is on the menu, crunchy, sweet, zesty, and delicious, 
remember to ask for alacarte if you want a larger portion.
They remember me almost every time (no beansprouts) lol, and with their large 
customer base that is quite a nice touch. They do however stop answering their
phone if they get busy and stop taking delivery orders if they do answer. So if 
you can't get through and its still during business hours just drive over 
and go inside. The prices are great, it is one of the least 
expensive Thai places we've ever seen. All in all this is our go-to Thai 
place, although there are a few areas they could step it up a bit, the value 
can't be beaten.

This place is perfect.  I don't understand how you could review this place anything less than 5 stars. It's extremely delicious, the portions are large, and the price is unbelievably cheap. Should be illegal how cheap it is. I often tip extra just because I don't think the price is fair. My favorite thing is basil leaf fried rice and pork jerky.

BEST BROTH EVER! 

Some friends and I tried this place thinking we could order pho soup. But, the menu had similar soups and rice places, but not pho. We still tried their lunch special (soup of the day, side and 1 or 2 food items for $7 or $9 - Great Deal!), and I had the roasted duck soup with rice noodles. You can choose between four noodle styles with the soups. Delicious!

The three of us only paid $17, which was great! Service wasn't the best, but it was the norm for a busy lunchtime. Definitely visiting again!

I've been getting Thai food from here for a while now. It's fast, inexpensive and the food is amazing! 

Update: WTF happened to this place?! The last few times I've come it's taken over 40 minutes for my food with literally 2 customers inside, I couldn't even call in advance because they don't answer the phone for take out orders. I give up on this place and I'm never coming back.

Let me take you on a journey:

First stop, chicken wings that were not cooked through. Raw in the middle. The scariest thing was when the guy didn't show surprise, simply muttered a "sorry" took the raw wings and disappeared. 

Second stop: Never refilled our drinks once. 

Third stop: They forgot one of our party's order. We had to tell them they completely forgot someone's order, and the response was "oh".  Seriously. 

Glad this journey didn't end with a stop into the emergency room.

Went for first time there with my son & his friend yesterday. Food was good. I had beef meatball noodle soup. Halfway through, I found a caterpillar in my soup! I didn't take a picture because I was too shocked. The waiter apologized & brought another bowl. When the check came, I noticed that he still charged me for the soup. A good business man wouldn't charge it but I just shrugged it off. I gave him a $100 bill but he came back & told me the bill is too old. What?! The bill is not old! It was a clean bill, no tear or anything. So I paid with a credit card. With that first impression, I will take my business elsewhere. The food (other than the caterpillar floating in my soup) was good but not that good. My mom (Thai) makes better beef meatball soup, from scratch.

We were tired yesterday and decided to stop here for dinner. Big mistake, it's the middle of the night and I'm awake.  I know the culprit. MSG!!! Don't eat here if you don't want MSG in your food. The food was boring and bland too. It wasn't even good.

Thai is my comfort food... Papaya salad... And Tom yum with shrimp.. (I only eat fish/seafood/tofu)  (a pescetarian).  And the green curry w tofu...This place is hittin.  Delivery will ALWYS get a review from me, so.. Here it is!  Wish they were open later and they DONT have fresh spring rolls... Only fried... Not a plus... Delivery is swift and food hits the spot.  Enjoy!

Sadly, this place has gone down hill. When they opened the restaurant was bright and stylish. The wall decals are now peeling, the white seats are visibly filthy. The lunch special, which is about the same price as a full size entree, includes a gelatinous egg drop soup. Frankly, it was inedible. You have a choice of appetizer. Egg roll, fried wonton, or fried tofu. Never pick the fried tofu. It's disgusting. My entree was Spicy String Bean with Chicken, which was good, but tiny. It was literally smaller than the scoop of rice included. 

Service is hit or miss; they never seem to answer the phone and they more than happy to make you wait half an hour to refill water or bring your check.. When the restaurant is empty.

If you must go here, get takeout of a full size entree, steering away from the chinese dishes. They are inedible. Try the noodle or curry dishes. The thai soups are also good (not the egg drop.)

I was hoping to find a home-away-from-home Thai restaurant in the Summerlin area since my boyfriend lives on that side of town. 

I tried to phone in ahead to have it ready for take out, but they weren't answering the phone. I went in and ordered pad see ew with tofu and felt that the noodles were undercooked, and the sauce wasn't the traditional oyster sauce served with this dish. 
My boyfriend ordered chicken red curry and they gave him tofu by mistake. The worst part was that the lady who took my order read it back to me, and the ticket was correct, but there was an error on that kitchen's part. 

They restaurant was busy so I'm hoping they were just having an off night. The prices are cheaper than most Thai restaurants but I wouldn't come back here if I was craving it and would head to Archi's instead.

Good food coupled with good service.

Have been a customer at both the Wynn Rd and Ft Apache locations, this location is closer to home so far more convenient.

The food is delicious, flavorful and plentiful. All at a very reasonable price.

Duck curry and duck rice are two of my favorite dishes here.

My family and I decided to come here last night, what a delight! The manager came over and introduced herself while telling us that they were short staffed. Honestly, the food was totally worth the extra 10-15 mins we waited. There wasn't one thing that anyone ordered that wasn't eaten completely. Clean plates for all of us! And the prices were superb! 
My husband and I had: shrimp Tum yum, chicken satay, grilled chicken salad and red curry, the total, $36! You can't beat that!! Can't wait to go back!

Great food. Decent price and Very spicy... just the way i like it. 
They delivered to my house and the food felt so hot it was as if it just came of the stove!

This place was horrible, their service was terrible, and the food was ok. No napkins were given when the food was served and I had to ask for a refill. When waiting for the check I had get up and find a server who was sitting down eating their lunch at the same time. No kind of condiments were made available while I ate making this experience an unpleasant one. I will NOT return for seconds!

Ordered chicken satay, chicken pad Thai and Thai ice tea. DELISH!! Great price and nice portions!!! I had my food delivered and was very please with how fast they got here and the food was still hot!! Definitely coming back for more!

I finally made it to this newer location and the first thing I noticed was the very small size of the restaurant. It's probably less than half the size of the one in the SW. That's not a bad thing cuz size doesn't matter...just as long as you can work with what you got. The decor is actually very stunning. It was decorated with all my fave elements: glass mosaic tile, high back chairs with button tufting, and a beautiful chandelier. It was an aesthetic, pleasant surprise to see a mom and pop establishment so nicely decorated.

Anyhow, I've been craving some noodles and I went with the intention of ordering the Thai beef noodle soup. From what I can remember, Thai noodle soup has a much better flavor than pho IMO. As I was looking at the different noodle soups I noticed one called Pork and Fish Ball noodle soup. Man, I am so glad I went with his one--this bowl of soup was absolutely delightful. You get your choice of four different types of noodles, i went with the flat rice noodles for my bowl. It contains pork, ground pork, and fish balls in a chicken broth. It is garnished with fried garlic, which is the one ingredient that pulls all these great flavors together so well. The broth had a nice clean taste to it with a hint of white pepper. It looks pretty simple but the flavors are so good, I didn't wanna mess with it by adding anything to it. I left it unembellished and ate it all as it came. This is one of the few noodle soup dishes that I didn't feel the need to doctor up with hoison or sriracha.

The ingredients in this soup was reminiscent of what comes in my fave noodle soup dish called Phnom Penh noodles. The Vietnamese make a version of this soup and they call it hue tieu Nam Vang but I have not been able to find a worthy substitute for my PP noodles until now. 

Great prices, great noodle dishes and friendly service. So glad this 3rd location opened up so I don't have to go to Chinatown or the SW for some awesome noodle soup.

If you're looking for a good thai food spot with great prices this is it. Every Curry I've had is good. The tom kha and tom yum soups are always a great start with tons of flavor. And the thai beef salad is delicious.

Was is the mood for Thai Food and found this hidden gem. The pot stickers are the best I've ever had, chicken satay was tender and tasty. For our main course we had the beef noodle soup and chicken Pad Thai.....amazing!!!! You are dumb not to try this place!

Their lunch specials are reasonably priced and tasty too.  Went here for lunch with a friend on a Sunday and we had an yummy meal as well as excellent service.  My friend ordered panang curry and I had tofu & vegetables.  My friend also ordered a papaya salad to go.  The waitresses were nice and very helpful explaining dishes and spice levels.  I would return to try other items on their menu!

Cheap, with vegan options! Yum! I The portions are huge for the appetizer and sides so if you're only a little hungry or have only a little money, so for a side and/or an appetizer. My favorite is the plain fried rice, no egg, with tofu!

I found a new little Thai Spot close to the house they deliver tried some new things the green curry fried rice was yummy also had shrimp pineapple red curry that was super yummy ordered my go-to Pad See Ew noodles also delicious service is good it's small but cute the wontons were a little different not sure if I cared for those so much but all in all I will be going back

Absolutely amazing place! If u haven't given it a chance yet, please do so. We went there  while trying to find a thai place in this area of town and as soon as we walked in we weere hooked! 
This might seem odd, but i feel like i get more shrimp in my pad thai when i dine in, rather than when i have food delivered or pixking it up. 
Overall, i will be going back for a long long time!!!!
Had lunch specials very tasty. Will definitely go back. Fast, courteous service, nice atmosphere.
