When we showed up they only had a table for 2 left, it was packed, but with only 12 tables you blink and it's a waiting list.  It might be tiny on size but the dishes had alot and were very good.  I had the chicken pad thai and the bbq chicken over rice, they both were very good.  One per son waiting on the entire place but it semed to work.  Going back for the soup next time-bowls were huge!!

Good food. Not expensive at all. Ordered Pad Thai, Orange chicken and sweet and sour pork. It wasn't bad. Orange chicken was delicious! So was sweet and sour pork... but it didn't have very much pork, it was more vegetables. And Pad Thai was decent. It was more spicy than flavorful, I've had better Pad Thai for sure. I will come back to try other menu items since this was our first visit.

Good golly, if it weren't for my co-workers asking one another, "where do you wanna go for lunch?" and defaulting to Thai food 3 to 4 times a week, I probably wouldn't come to Thai Noodle House as often as I do.

Items on the menu are reasonably priced whether you go ala carte or go with a lunch combo.

If you have an hour for lunch and you're withn 4-miles of this particular location, the service is quick that you can sit, enjoy your meal, and back to work on time..
Food here is amazing, very authentic, and quick service. Also it's very reasonably priced, definitely one of my go to places for Thai/Chinese food.

The best Thai food for your buck, hands down. My mother has owned a Thai restaurant for over 25 years and this place has great food! The value is unbeatable and the service is great too! I highly recommend this restaurant. I haven't tried the other locations as this is the closest one to my house. It's my husband and I's go to spot when we decide to eat out. They will customize your order any way you'd like, my usual is Eggplant with Green Bean stir fry, love it!

They must put drugs in the food, because I'm addicted! Haha. This is our local Thai place that's right around the corner. My husband an I have been here several times (both take out and dine in) and we have had amazing food each time. So far we haven't had one thing we really disliked. Our favorite things here are the green curry, and the Tom Kha soup. Definitely recommend this place for take out or a quick, casual dine in. Maybe you'll be hooked too! ;-P

Food was mediocre (tofu and vegetable lunch special) to good (Noodle House Tom Yum Soup Bowl), but not great. Service was poor. Despite having two waitresses asking us the same things over and over, we had to ask for water 4 times before actually getting any.
I truly enjoy this place for thai food. They are close to home and decent priced. Have yet to be dissatisfied with their food.

The perfect little gem in Summerlin. I just had dinner there yesterday & I want more! The Tom Kha soup has a lighter, fresher taste than most I've tried, and the chicken & shrimp Pad Thai was delish. Can't wait to try  other items on the menu.

I like the Thai fried rice because it is a good price for a decently large portion which makes it easy to pick up for dinner and have as leftovers the next day. But I've noticed if you don't say "Thai fried rice" and just "fried rice" they do taste different so be careful of that. Most other things I've tried are decent but not amazing like the pad seeu is better sometimes than others because at times it has a bitter after taste even when it tastes good at first. Their crab wontons are pretty good (hard to mess those up) and their Thai soup has good flavor.

Came here two days in a row! Its in the same plaza as Smith's. The service was good, gets busy around lunch but I've been able to get a seat fast.

Item: Combination Beef Noodle Soup
Portion: Big
Flavor: 5/5
Price: $8
Reminded me of Taiwanese beef noodle soup except a little bit more sour and less spicy. 

Item: Mango Sticky Rice
Portion: Small
Flavor: 3/5
Price: $5
The ratio of mango to rice was disappointing. They gave small slivers of mango compared to the bowl of rice. 

I wouldn't go back for their dessert but that soup is killer.

The best Thai food I have had so far in Vegas. We went there for dinner a few months ago. This little restaurant is located near W lake mead and Rampart in Summerlin. We tried Pad See ew, duck fried rice, pad thai, they were all delicious. The Thai tea was the best thai tea. The price was cheap in my opinion and comes in generous portion. It was the best Thai food I have had. The service was good. I can't wait to go back again.
I had the lunch combo. Ginger chicken, wontons and rice. Good neighborhood restaurant.

I come here often since it's close to my house. Lately, the service hasn't been great and the food isn't as good, but I still liked it. Yesterday, 1/6/17 I was there with my friend and our chicken was completely pink on the inside. Make sure your food is thoroughly cooked if you come here.
Beef noodle combination, excellent! Waiter service can be a little better but, food is great! Orange chicken is light, crispy breaded.

Thai style noodle house is my absolute go-to place. 
It is clean, affordable, and has tasty food.

 My favorites: 
- crab rangoon 
-  crispy noodle with wonton 
- chicken fried rice (for a healthier alternative I sub it with brown rice) 

I have never been dissatisfied with this place!

Super Authentic noodle soup. We went there on the off chance as we just moved here and dint really know whats good. This place was awesome. Satay was moist and tasty. The Mrs got the combo beef soup and i got the thai noodle combo.  They were both packed with flavor. Noodles were good if not slightly overcooked but all in sll it reminded me of being in Bangkok. Try it!

So you walk in the restaurant & a female worker kinda calls out with "for here or to go", not hello or anything that resembles a greeting to welcome you to their establishment.   The customer service tonight was almost non - existing, except for the male worker who at least checked on us & seemed more personable. Thank goodness the food was good.
Love this place! Food is good & it's ridiculously cheap. Plus it's not too far from the house ANDDD they deliver. So bonus points for that haha

Quick and easy review. 2 pick lunch special is amazing. The food is good. Food for the price is amazing. Still working on the dessert list so expect an update in the future. Small location but is currently expanding into the suite next door, so will be able to seat more soon. Thai Style is a good solid place to enjoy some Thai Food, and is located in a great location within the smith shopping center!

This place is pretty close to my home and so good! My husband and I always get the chicken yellow curry with with the pot sticker appetizer or the crab rangoon app to go and it's all very tasty. You can't beat the price either!

This place is solid for a quick Thai treat...it's not the BEST Thai food on the planet or anything, but if you want good Thai food at a great price, look no further than here.  I've had their red, yellow, panang curries...chicken satay and crab Rangoon...I always feel like it was good and the portions are large so you don't feel like you didn't get enough food.  I didn't particularly like the pad Thai, but I go to Lotus of Siam if I want the best pad Thai.  The convenient location of this place along with the good quality food at a value price makes it a great lunch spot or if you are struggling to find dinner after a hard day.  Service is always spot on and if they don't answer the phone just call back...they are busy!

I'm mixed on this place for a few reasons, but thought to round up based on the reason of coming here: for the food.

So on a Saturday night, we were craving Thai food in the area. It seems every place needs a reservation, even a Thai restaurant. The one down the street, I could understand as it was an "upscale" version of one. This place, however, seemed to be a mom and pop place that was like any other noodle houses from the LA area I am used to. Just to be sure, I called to see if they needed reservations. The lady on the phone, who spoke non-fluent English, claim I need a reservation for 2 kids and 2 adults. I had a feeling this was yet another place pulling my leg with the "need reservations on a Saturday night." And yes, it was one of those spots that lied.

We showed up 10 minutes after I called... to an empty noodle house other than 3 tables occupied. Just as I thought: another place claiming you needed reservations. What was a bit of an insult in addition to that notion was the fact that this place has zero customer service! No hello, no smile, no glance. We stood there for close to 5 minutes until a staff finally said they would be with us. Ok...

Again, the place was rather empty at 6pm-ish on a Saturday, with the exception of hearing a grumbling waitress telling us to order quickly as they're backlogged on orders mainly due to deliveries. So now it's slowly making sense!

Anywho, why were we here--to grub!!!! I will say this: the food here is delicious enough that the non-existent customer service can be waived. We tried the pat see ew and pineapple fried rice: basic Thai food that can easily be botched due to catering to the "American" taste buds and not actual Thai. Is this actual Thai? To a point. I can tell from the seasoning that Chinese spices such as Maggi sauce seasoning and Chinese 5-spices powder were used on both of the dishes...but it made the food good! So good that the 2 adults scarfed down every piece of food on our plates. And it was not because we waited around 40 minutes after we ordered to finally eat (hey, they did give us a heads up).

Food: good
Price: even better for the food!
Customer Service: subpar

Overall, I would give this place another shot if I happen to be in the area. I just hope that blowing off customers own the phone claiming they need reservations when it wasn't the case does not deter you from eating at this tiny joint!

Awesome food and super cheap with most dishes being under $7 and still very generous portions.  I've had the Pad See-eu and Khua Kai noodles and both were awesome, though not that spicy even though I asked for a Level 7 on the spiciness.  Level 7 spicy at Pan Asian just about burned my mouth off.  Still 5 stars though, will be one of my favorite lunch spots.

Yelp led me here and I am pleased. Portions are like they say -- ample! Excellent value and great flavor. We had Pad Thai with chicken and Yellow Curry with chicken. My boyfriend and I like it spicy (heh) so we got levels 5 and 7, respectively. The spice didn't overtake the flavor and I love me some coconut.

Not too oily, good quality ingredients. Quick service (we called ahead for take out). Would like to return and dine-in perhaps, storefront was cute with a few diners enjoying their own meals.

Well. I dont know what to say... except this is the shittiest customer service ever. It's so unbelievable how RUDE the staff is. No greeting. Then they huff and puff when you read the menu. Then huff and puff when you are ordering not in their speed. A customer asked when her soup is ready... they huffed and puffed and told her to just wait. Wow. If they huff and puff any more, they might as well audition for the Three Little Pigs broadway show. Oh before I forget, I asked for a menu and the lady said "it's right there!" and pointed with her lips. What. The. The food better be good cus this is so not worth the trip. People eating in the dining area just sad or upset. We end up to-go'ing or I will snap at these a-holes. I will be back to add more review after we try the food.

Im back to give a food review. Well. It's good. The cook definitely knows what he's doing. Kudos to him! He earned the extra 2 stars. The only way I would come back is if we have the food to-go. Otherwise, just go to Pin Kaow down the street. Now, they have great customer service and delicious food. I just thought to try something new and this place just disappointed us.

Went here for my co-worker's farewell dinner and just wow. They have great service (my food came 10 ish minutes after ordering) , all the waiters are super funny and kind and the food is delicious. The price is pretty good too. There's nothing on the menu that is above ten dollars. The Pad Thai, Fried Chicken over Fried Rice and the Duck Soup are some of my favorites. And the best part? They have fried ice cream! Not those crappy fried ice cream dipped in cereal, but ones they actually fried. Will definitely keep coming back!

Do yourself a favor and dont come in expecting to get any meat in your dishes and you wont be disappointed.
Went in for lunch with hubby today and staff was so abrupt that we decided to get the  food to go. Wait staff acted busy, but no one was there. The girl who took our order was acting like i was wasting her time. No need to have to tell someone off when you  can get the food and go.
Ordered fried wontons, chicken  fried rice,  and bbq pork over rice. RIP OFF!!!! Please see my pics of this crap.... you have been warned.
Wontons were burnt so burnt they are only good  for scratching itchy gums.  No meat in them but they cost 7 bucks???
Chicken fried rice was decent, the was about a tablespoon of chicken in the whole dish. But the rice was okay... so you get one star
Bbq pork was flavorless and tough, real tough almost like jerky but bigger and more expensive. 
I came here because the reviews were decent but now im thinking folks in this area are just used to settling for what they can get. 
I wont be back, wouldn't recommend and will steer folks  away from...

I love pad Thai so we went looking for a new place as I love eating at different restaurants. We stumbled upon this little family owned place off of lake mead and rampart - thanks to Yelp. They get a 10 for value price. Most plates start at $6.95 and average at about $8.00. 
Good food quality and presentation I give a solid 9. I had the combination pad Thai and we shared a yummy serving of chicken red curry. My daughter had the Mongolian beef. All plates came extremely hot and fresh. Just the way I love it. Simply but clean presentation. Definitely one of my top 10 places to eat great Thai food.

I was here last week with my girlfriend from reading the reviews in yelp! Have to tell you the food is great with respectable price as well. The menu has illustrated photos on which entrées you would like to choose from. Very clean restaurant. I will be here again soon. Btw, the yellow curry w/chicken is crazy Delicious!!

I love this place I can eat here every day
I always get Mongolian beef or chicken pad thai spicy level three. It's never failed me.
Every other restaurant that has been at this location has failed to last. This one has been here for many years now, so it has proven itself. They actually not only survived, but they expanded into the spot next door. The decor is beautiful, customer service is always good, and food excellent and fast.
Best thai place in town. I would highly recommend Tom Ka, red curry and pad thai. I went to Nattayas and it was good but twice as expensive.

I've been at the number 2 and this one is better by a lot. The deco feels like expensive but everyone was so relaxed that it felt good. The Panang Avocado with salmon was ok. Im not into "gravy" kind curry but lots of avocado and chunks of salmon it was great for the price. My wife had red duck curry and it was really good with the pineapple bits. Bistro kind of place and not expensive at all.
Amazing food for super cheap with great service! One of my favorite thai places in Las Vegas for sure

We come here a couple times a week.. The food is delicious but inconsistent. The staff is NOT accommodating.. Even for regulars. Sometimes Victor from the Tropicana location is there helping out and he is great.. But most of the staff is rude. The last couple of times we've been in, it has been inconsistent.  We always order the soup..and last time we were shorted on broth.. They made up an excuse that they were changing the portions.. However, today it was back to being the normal portion.. I found a long, curly HAIR in my soup and not only did they charge me for the entire thing (minus a measly 10% for the inconvenience ) but they didn't even offer to remake it for me! I feel that they should have taken care of us..but there wasn't even an apology! We asked to speak to a manager but there were none on duty.. (Apparently, there is never a manager on duty! Who knows what else they do to the food?!)
When we told our server that we weren't satisfied with our experience, she was rude, unaccommodating and uncaring. We told her we won't be back and that they just lost some good clients to which she said 
"Ok."

This place is phenomenal!! Prices are awesome as well.  They have huge portion sizing and the flavor of food is great.  My favorite is the pad see u and the red chicken curry.  They have great delivery if you live close or within 3 miles. Service is excellent everytime we visit.  Give this place a try!!

I LOVE THIS PLACE! Visited few times already and will definitely come back. My favorite Thai food place.

ATMOSPHERE
I remember when I first moved to Vegas, this place was an Hawaiian plate lunch place. It was a bright and welcoming place. Now it looks completely different; modern and clean. I just love walking in here.

SERVICE
Better than other restaurants I've been to. Servers here are helpful and very fast. I'm always impressed because there are usually only 2 servers but they provide fast and great service to each and every single customers.

FOOD
Their menu is a bit overwhelming because there are so many choices! If you don't know what to order from here, I recommend:
-Beef combination noodle (love the soup! you can choose the type of noodles. Egg noodle is my favorite)
-Ginger snapper (LOTS of vegetables)
-Orange chicken (always fresh and crispy!)
Food is usually served within 10-15 mins.

CONCLUSION
I have been to many Thai food places but this is my favorite one out of all because of their fast service and delicious food!

I'm so happy I gave this Thai Noodle House another try because it has now become my favorite take-out!

A sore throat brought me in yearning for something warm and comforting to sooth it.

I ordered the sliced beef Thai noodle soup bowl with wide noodles and the hubby ordered the mixed beef with ramen noodles.  

I would advise the sliced beef if you're ordering this dish. The mixed beef has some mushroom looking cuts that resemble liver so for me the sliced beef was the winner. 

I got it to-go.  However, if you stay in and dine.  Check your good table manners at the door and forget everything your momma taught you because this delicious slurpable broth with loads of flavor, crunchy fresh bamboo shoots and bok choy nesting on top will leave you slurping and licking your bowl dry while begging for more. That is if you can finish it-because the serving is PLENTY for TWO.

My secret:  Add some lime to the broth it will add and enhance the flavor.

Go get your noodle soup now!

Just as good as the Thai Style Noodle House #1, and even better than Thai Style Noodle House #2!  

The only other Thai restaurant within close proximity is Nattaya's and this one to me beats her out.  We're presented with good Thai food at a lower cost than the one across the street.  Compared to all three locations this one is the nicest with the most upgrade in furniture. 

My favorites are still the specials on the board, especially the salmon that I first tried on Spring Mountain.  I've had the Roasted Duck Fried Rice, Roasted Duck Noodle Soup, Roasted Duck Curry, and if they had a Roasted Duck Ice Cream I'd probably be all over that.  But I like eating in rather than taking out or having them delivered because I like to use the spice, sauce, vinegar that's delivered to your table.  The food is greasy but so good, I've also had the Chicken Satays that comes with the peanut butter sauce which was good and I like to judge a place by their Chicken Satay and sauce.

Great little place for some good Thai food!

Located on N. Rampart in the Smith's shopping center, Thai Style is located on a near corner of a lot.  Go slow or you might miss it because the place is tiny.  Really, there might be just over a dozen tables available for dining in.  But that's ok because Thai Style has no problems with doing take-out for you.  If you do dine in though don't worry, the place is nicely appointed!  New tables, chairs, paint.  Good ambiance, especially when it's quiet.  I hear during lunch is when the crowd is probably the biggest.

Came here with the wifey for a quiet dinner one night after we heard their second location opened up here near our side of town.  Really felt like the place was our own, there were only two other tables taken nearby, and on the counter was multiple orders ready for pickup.

The menu at Thai Style is fairly authentic feeling, with some dishes looking like they may have got a bit of an American touch.  We stuck with what we were hoping was simple and basic, but had a lot of flavor.

I love noodles, but really wasn't feeling Pad Thai.  We instead opted for the Pad See-Eu - stir-fried thick flat rice noodles (almost like chow fun) with egg and Chinese broccoli, all in a sweet dark soy sauce.  This was delicious.  The rice noodles with the sweet soy sauce was heavenly, and was given good texture with the addition of the Chinese broccoli.  It makes perfect leftovers, great midnight snack in front of the TV while watching Breaking Bad reruns!

We also had the Fried Chicken over Fried Rice - marinated, fried chicken breasts over a bed of Thai Jasmine fried rice.  This was good as well.  I would have liked the chicken to be a bit more flavorful, and a bit of a thicker piece.  However, it was yummy with the Thai fried rice which had egg, garlic, onion, salt, and pepper.  The rice was seasoned easily but just right.  And the portion was huge, more than enough for two people to share.

We got out of Thai Style with full bellies and some leftover change.  The bill was not bad at all, our total for two entrees, tax, and tip was under $19.  That was a plus!  We will be back to try other dishes, I really am interested in their red and yellow curries.

Thai Style runs some amazing lunch specials too, for short of $7 you can get a choice of TWO (yep, two) entrée options from a pretty big list, and each lunch special comes with soup, rice, and an egg roll.  Don't want two entrees?  Do just one, and pay less than $6!  Dealio.

I really don't know how this restaurant got a 4-star overall rating - this is some of the worst Thai food I have ever had. I've lived in Thailand and have had Thai food all over the world, and hands down this is some of the worst. The shrimp in our tom yum tasted spoiled (super   mushy, crumbled in my mouth - I had to spit it out). The seafood fried rice lacked flavor, and the chicken pad kaprow was dry. The only thing that was decent was the Thai iced tea. The inexpensive prices at this restaurant aren't worth it - there are plenty of other better places in Vegas.

You get what you pay for... very bad service, average food. Thai green curry with vegetable more spicy than tasteful. $7.85 . When I walk in, I have been seat at a dirty table. Not very enjoyable waitress who forget to smile, draining her feet  and drop your plate on the table like "eat that" of course when you pay cash, there is no ticket coming back.
I love thai food!  I'll miss this place.  I've eaten here almost every day during my stay.  Prices are great, favors are addictive and the atmosphere and service are friendly and casual.  A must try!
This Thai restaurant is a great value for the amount of food you receive. Food comes out fast and taste great
I'm picky and this place past the test. My favorite is steamed tofu curry. The staff is friendly, professional and patient when I cannot decide what to order.

Great lunch specials, their curry is fantastic and the mango n rice... mmmmmm

They are friendly, orders are always consistent and correct, food is awesome.
First time trying this place!  Hit the spot!  Wanted authentic Thai noodle, this was great!  Seafood, chicken chopped, pork, fish balls, fish cake...  DELISH!!!

Worth stoping by and trying it out.

I've dined here quite a few times as I have found it to be good quality Thai food that doesn't take to long to get served.

Noodle house has a few other restaurants in town that have been successful. So I guess it made sense to open in this part of town.

Always try the duck fried rice. It's one of my favorite dishes here with noodle house classic pot stickers to boot!

I will say the delivery a couple of times has takin quite a while and sometimes cold when received. Also calling up to order for pick up or delivery has been hard to get through.

I do believe though going in a sitting down for a meal here you won't be disappointed...

Delicious take-out Thai food. Pad Thai was okay... But really enjoyed the fried rice with Chinese sausage and pork. The Panang Beef sauce was delish!!!

Also get the chicken basil. Makes a perfect pairing with Pad Thai and steamed rice drizzle with Panang curry sauce. That's how you eat Thai food folks!

35 bucks = 3 dishes and comfortably fed four people.

Don't know what happened, but the taste has really changed here. I usually go to the one on Trop but used to come to this location in the past. I went today for a quick lunch and got spicy eggplant that was mostly bland and gravy with so much oil, I just paid and left it uneaten. I'm not going back. They said they had a new chef and offered to fix it, but i didn't trust it would get better. Too bad, it used to be a good place. Maybe their other dishes are still good but I won't find out.

I am really starting to like Thai Style Noodle House.  I have never been disappointed with the food and service last night was top notch.  I was talked into trying the chicken pot stickers and I am glad it happened.  They were awesome.  For a place that serves food relatively quickly and at a good price I was not expecting an appetizer dish to look so appealing.  6 dumplings lined up and topped with two sauces, soy and some sort of seasoned mayonaise.  Add to that green onions and sesame seeds and what a nice treat to add to my main entree order of pad see-eu.  That was good too.  I had a craving for flat rice noodles and this hit the spot.   You better believe I will be back many more times.

I used to love this place dearly. Unfortunately the last couple times I have gone the service has been lackluster and the staff has been rude. If you ask for something as simple as veggies added to a dish they charge a few dollars extra and throw in a couple onions slices and a stem of broccoli. The food just tastes like they use off-cuts in everything and cheaper recipes for their dishes now. There's more spice than flavor. It just seems like they've really tried to cut the costs and it's at the customers expense. Like I said I've given it a couple tries after the first bad time and it hasn't improved at all. I wish it wasn't true but this place has gone downhill a lot.

I love it here , the food that is. The service is a bit eh. Every time I come there seems to be an issue. The only reason I come back is for the food. I'm giving them a 3.5. Amazing food but not the best Service. I have witnessed gossip , no service due to staff eating , confused about my dietary restricting. Their pad see ew is my favorite, their broccoli is so fresh!

This is one of the only Thai places on the NW side of town, and thankfully it's very good.  Had it for the first time tonight and tried the green curry, chicken satay, chicken pad thai, tom kha soup, and mango rice.  Everything was great- it's traditional Thai comfort food. 

We ordered it for pickup, it was ready on time, and the restaurant was nice and clean. They did mix up the spice levels, and made my curry very spicy when I only wanted a spice level 1.  The to-go mango rice seemed pretty small as well.  Staff was friendly.  Pin Kaow is better, but if you're in Summerlin this place will do!

This little gem is my favorite Thai place! The staff is super friendly, and always helpful with anything I ask for. 
A cozy atmosphere; this place is good for one, two or small groups of 8-10. They serve many different Thai dishes and the following are some of my favorites:
Papaya Salad
Silver Noodle Salad
Pad Thai
Both the Red and Green Curry
Duck Fried Rice
Three Companion Pork
Tom Ka- chicken
Tom Yum 

This far everything I've ordered from this place is delicious AND full of
Flavor. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for good Thai and great prices!!!

I was a bit hesitant to eat here just because it's such a random spot for a noodle house to be in, right next to my smith's? But good thing the bf did his research on yelp when i was craving yummy soup!

This place was packed Friday night,I didn't expect this place to look so nice, it was an actual sit in restaurant that's nicely decorated.

 it's a small place but the food was GREAT! prices were great too! it was 6.95 for a bowl of Beef Stew Noodle soup and it was a pretty big bowl and couldn't even finish it! Their soup was very flavorful without being too powerful. 
We also tried their Pad see ew and the Chicken Panang curry. The pad see ew was not the best but it was still pretty good, and the chicken panang was okay. I'll be back to try their other Thai dishes and Soups.
DEFINITELY try their soups b/c the Soup alone earned this place the 4 stars:) 

One down side, there's no restroom in this restaurant so i had to hold it..
actually 2 down sides, the table got a little crowded for me and my boyfriend but i guess that's our fault for ordering too much! 

TRY it! 

plus the servers were really nice.

I ordered the chicken red curry with a 5 spice, and the beef pad see ew also with a 5 spice and both dishes were absolutely delicious! I've been to many Thai restaurants in town, and this was definitely one of the best! I ordered it for delivery to work and they arrived a little before the promised time. The guy who took my order over the phone and the delivery guy were both super nice and polite!

This place is great. Best value of any place I've found in Vegas. Food is great, prices are extremely cheap, service has always been good in all the time I've eaten here. All around you can't go wrong.

Orange chicken was delicious. Super light and crispy with not too much sauce. Very yummy. 

Chicken pad Thai wasn't bad. It was pretty good but not the best I've had. My mom ordered it 5/10 for spice and it was far too spicy for her. I got a 2 and it was just right for me.. I'm a spice wimp. 

Fried wanton appetizer was quite tasty. Extremely crispy on the verge of being a little overcooked, but it was OK.

Service was good. Cup was never empty which is a plus. Its a small place but was enjoyable. I'd go back because the food was great for the prices. Serving sizes were pretty large for the $6-$7 price per dinner plate.

I've done dine-in and to-go several times and haven't had a problem. I noticed they extended their restaurant. I walked in and asked for seating for two. Ended up being seated in the extended portion to be forgotten. The woman who sat me dropped the menus and was long gone and almost 10 mins pass when i decide to walk out. I think it's best for them to turn people away at the door than forget about them in the back.

The servings are generous, the price is affordable, the decor is clean, the servers are nice, and the food is Noms! It's a win, win for Thai food all around. 

I love that they serve papaya salad as a side to some of their meat dishes along with the traditional sticky rice. Not too many places do that, but it's how a lot of Thai's would serve you if you came over to their house for dinner. Legit.

The house potstickers are really delicious. The food was great. The waitress was very friendly. My only complaint was that my daughter's meal didn't come out until 10 min after everyone else's meal. I would definitely come back though.

Delicious thai food but the original one on Spring Mountain in Chinatown is better. The go-to order is always:

- Red Duck Curry - spicy (THE BEST!!)
- Pad See Ew with beef- spicy

These two dishes, the red duck curry especially, haven't been done better anywhere else. The red duck curry has huge chunks of duck in a creamy red curry broth with generous pieces of pineapple. Affordable, delicious, and one of my staples when I'm craving thai food.
WOW!  Fantastic Food and great prices.  What more do you need to know?

Awesome place to grub if your hungry! 

The soups are top shelf, all of them and the Thai tea was perfect! Soup was out fast and the dudes in there were fast and helpful. I recommend this place to anyone that's interested! So so bomb!

The first time we went here, we ate in and had a great meal, and I gave it 4 stars.  We were so happy after that first visit that we returned and took along another couple - who may be moving to our fair city - to introduce them to life as locals.  Our experience was less than stellar.  But I didn't update my review then.  On the second visit, I ordered the same salmon dish I had the first time, and it was so bad I had to send it back.  The waitress tried to explain that they use frozen salmon, and yada, yada.  Its replacement was just ordinary.  The other couple were split 50-50 in their opinions of their dishes.

During our first visit we wanted to get more information about take-out, figuring that we'd be doing that on a regular basis.  We particularly wanted to know about the soup.  Our Tom Kha was fabulous, and it was such a big bowl that we couldn't imagine we'd get that much if we had it as take-out, but the waitress assured us it was a very big container.

So on this uncharacteristically rainy night, we opted for take-out from Noodle House.  My first disappointment was taking an ordinary Chinese restaurant-type plastic container out of the bag that was only three-quarters full.  It turned out not to matter:  the soup was so unbearably spicy that we couldn't finish it.  It also had half the amount of chicken that our dine-in portion had.  

Four vegetable spring rolls were decent, but very greasy.  

We ordered our main dish, Pad Thai, as a chicken-beef-shrimp combination.  It had a "generous" helping of two rather small shrimp, chewy and flavorless beef, and some tender chicken.  This dish is usually very bland at other Thai restaurants, but this one was very spicy.  I didn't mind that, since it didn't cause smoke to come out of my ears like the soup did.  But the noodles were rubbery, and if it had chopped peanuts, there weren't enough to taste them.  A disappointment.

I guess it was too good to be true, but we'll go back to the other Thai restaurants we used to go to before our hopes were raised by the opening of Thai-Style Noodle House, which is so much closer to our home.  Those hopes sadly have been dashed.

Thai Style Noodle House has tasty Thai food for a great value. The prices are low and you get  sharable sized portions. 

I started off with the Appetizer combo which was about $7.95. It had Chicken Satay , Crispy Shrimp , one  Egg Roll, Crab Rangoon, Wontons, and  a tiny cucumber salad. It also came with dipping sauces (sweet and sour and peanut butter ). If I had to pick one thing off the platter the Crispy Shrimp would be my favorite . It is shrimp wrapped in a egg roll wrapper then deep fried. 

I ordered the BBQ & Chinese pork Fried Rice  for $6.95. This was plenty to split and also take some home for lunch the following day. The rice was delicious it wasn't soggy and had fresh veggies in it. I've seen some places that put frozen vegetables in their rice which is a total turn off. 

The service was great we had our drinks filled constantly which is important when eating spicy foods. Thai Style Noodle House is a chain so there is more than one you can go to in the Las Vegas Valley.

I will say that it is a good value. You get large portions for a little money. The quality isn't bad,and flavor is okay too. 
However,.... there is also, nothing spectacular, and nothing amazing that I experienced.
We ordered via phone for delivery,  delivery time was estimated at an hour and a half, so decided to pick it up instead. 
Ordered: the Fried Snapper, didn't specify the "whole fried snapper". oops...... the version we got was still tasty.
Ordered the basil fried rice, the duck fried rice, beef salad and the chicken pad see eu. The total bill was 41.00 and it was a lot of food.
The basil fried rice was good.The flavor was there, but I ordered spicy 6 and it wasn't quite spicy enough for me. I am used to Pan Asia spice.....
The Beef Salad was not at all to my liking. My husband liked it, but the flavors simply didn't jive at all.... a bitter kind of taste I thought. 
The Pad See Eu was bland.....The spicy levels are low here, so don't be afraid to order high! If I order here again I will order 8 or 9 spice level.
Also, I didn't order any curry..... It is hard to give a true and accurate review of a thai restaurant and you don't review any curry!?!?!?!

Delicious food and great customer service.  You can tell how good a restaurant is by how busy the place is and boy is this place busy.

Deliveries are usually between 30-60 min and the take it is about that long as well.  But the food is so worth it.  The chicken soup and the duck pad thai is soooooo good it's hard for me to order anything else when either sitting there or taking out or getting it delivered.

The food here is decent BUT the reason why I'm leaving 2 stars is because EVERY SINGLE TIME I order for delivery, the lady who takes my order does not speak good English AT ALL and there is always a communication barrier. It takes 20+ minutes to put in a simple delivery order. Insane! On top of that frustration, she gets upset with me because I make special requests (which are so simple btw) because I like my food prepared in a specific way and she seems to get overly irritated with me. Did I do something wrong by making a simple request of how I (the paying customer) likes to have my food prepared? I don't think so! She acts as if I'm difficult when in fact it's the other way around. 


Here's a solution: Put someone who speaks clear English to take delivery orders. 

This is EXTREMELY frustrating and the next time I visit in person I will be addressing it with the owner or manager and if they don't acknowledge this as a valid concern then you lose me as a customer forever. Not that they care but I'm making it known in case they read this review. I actually placed a delivery order today and experienced the same problem AGAIN. I will no longer be ordering from here because I get tired of dealing with people who can't speak English clearly enough to communicate effectively. Especially when I am a paying customer. If it was free I wouldn't care. But I spend $30+ every time and I get tired of the communication barrier.

Had to finally get that off my chest!

Went for lunch on a Monday, only a few other customers at the time but service was very slow. Took forever to take our order, because the waiter was as sitting behind us eating his lunch. Ordered the lunch special with yellow curry. 2 stars for the curry because it was decent. But the spring roll and wonton they give you is sad. Had to remind them about the soup because they brought our entrees first, by the time the soup came it was cold so it was a waste. I had high hopes for this place because its close by, but I think I will just drive to Pin Kaow next time.

We ordered the BBQ wonton soup, spicy basil noodles and the egg fried rice. Thai tea was very good. My combination spicy noodles level spice were really good, not too oily and they had a lot of vegetables and meat. The egg fried rice has delicious. Added rice noodles to the BBQ wonton soup and it was enough for 2 people. Prices are very reasonable which makes this place a great value. Nice decor complete s the experience. We will come again next time we visit Las Vegas!

Thai Noodle House is easily my favorite Thai food in Vegas, especially since my second choice closed down recently. The boo and I recently ordered take out from this location using UberEats. Our food actually arrived quicker than the quoted time which was nice surprise. 

We ordered the crab rangoons to share. They were perfectly cooked, crispy and did not skimp on the cream cheese filling. I also thought the portion size was pretty big for the price. (5/5) For an entree I had the Shrimp Pad Thai. I do wish they gave tofu as a meat option as well, but nonetheless the shrimp was delicious. I had mine at a 7 spicy, which I didn't think was too overly spicy at all. I probably could have gone higher. The portion size on this was also huge, enough for dinner and lunch the next day. (4/5) My boo had the Pad See-eu, it looked pretty tasty and I tried a couple of the noodles. Both solid noodle dishes. 

I can't comment on the service inside since we got delivery, but overall the food was very good.

WOW!  Great prices and delivery.

Loved the avocado curry and spicy basil tofu.

Love this local gem.  The food is always consistent and the service is always quick. The interior design throws you off a little but make no mistake, with all the Thai competition in town, this one holds its own. Here is the breakdown of a few staples:
Thai Noodle House Pot Stickers, Duck Fried Rice, Spicy Basil Leaf Fried Rice, Yellow Chicken Curry, Pad Thai with Shrimp, Garlic and Pepper Chicken (my favorite), and the Spicy String Beans with Ground Pork.  My mouth is watering just thinking about this place!  Make sure to order spice level 3 if you are not a big fan of spice, it is just enough for the flavor but not overly spicy!  If you live in the area, or just passing by, make sure to give them a shot. It's local flavors like this that make neighborhoods great!

We keep going back for more and more.  Everything I've tried has been good.  Fried tofu, pineapple fried rice, chicken fried rice, green curry, yellow curry, chicken satay, pad thai, panang curry, edamame, and on and on!  Nice dining room, never too long of a wait.  I'd say this is somewhat of a hidden gem since it's in the corner of the Smith's shopping center.

My wife loves it, my kids love it, I love it, and it doesn't matter if it's dine in, take out, or delivery.  Always good food and always good service.  

Make sure to specify you want to pay with a CC over the phone for delivery though, as they hung up after giving me the total and estimated wait before I had the chance to ask to pay with CC.  Fortunately I had the cash on me!
I had lunch here and my chicken was raw!!! Waitress did not even apologize and just said, "Oh." Horrible service. Eat at your own risk!!!!!!

I loved the décor of this Thai restaurant; they are definitely trying to be different from your typical Asian eatery. Although the décor was different, their food remained very authentic. I enjoyed eating their yellow, red curry and their pineapple fried rice, it was delicious! The only complain I had is that they do not ask you how spicy you want your curry to be. Most of the restaurants I have been to they always give you the option for it.
Ambiance: 8 out of 10
Food: 8 out of 10

I've been twice. Once for take out, and once dining in with my Mom. My take out experience was far better than my dining in. Really poor customer service while dining in. Had to ask for simple things like napkins because they were never given. 
I had their spicy Thai noodles and a Thai tea both times. The level of spiciness was very inconsistent. I got a 6 the first time and barely made it through the dish. Got a 6 the second time and tasted little to no heat. 
My Mom had the BBQ pork which she thought was dry. She kept putting the broth from the soup on it to make it semi palatable. 
Fried calamari appetizer was the best part of the meal.
Given it's close vicinity to my house, I'll probably only return if I'm really dying for some drunken noodles.

Im trying to call to order for pick up, called about 8 times seeing if it was the right number. They "answered" but no one said anything for 10 minutes. I just heard the restaurant noise. Sucks! I know the food is good. You missed out on a 8 person order.

Not very happy at all. Came here for the first time today. We got Yellow Curry (worst I've EVER had), Mongolian beef (ok), and Pad Thai noodles (which I really liked). Service was pretty good, other than every time our waiter went to the back and opened the door there was other music BLASTING. You would of thought there was a night club back there. The potatoes were definitely OLD in the curry, my rice was hard, my food got cold really fast and by that time I was so turned off I was ready to go.

My boyfriend and I go here at least 2x a week! 
Our favorites: Sliced beef noodle soup with small rice noodles and the yellow chicken curry. 
The entrees taste exactly the same, every time we order!
Is it sad that the servers know our orders?

I love this place. 

It's close by and prices are extremely reasonable! Some of their dishes are as close to authentic Thai food as I can get in this town. The staff is Thai and they service is fast and friendly. 

The food is yummy and great quality. I'm always weird about getting chicken at asian restaurants so I usually get beef. I feel like here, they are using only the breast so I get great chicken pieces in my dish. I grew up with chickens and sometimes, they were dinner so I'm picky and would only eat the breast if I had a choice. 

Portions are big! Big enough for me to make two meals out of. My boyfriend and I never spend over $20-26 here. This place never disappoints us! My favorite three dishes here are the Rad Nah, Pad Se Ew, Pad Thai. Mmm...

I was here for some take out. I ordered Pad See Eu with beef, Seafood Tom Yum and Fried Chicken with fried rice. My bill was $24 ish dollars. 

I am surprised by how huge their servings are! My tom yum didn't have any seafood in it:( it also lacks flavor and was very oily. The beef pad see eu was too sweet for my taste, and like the tom yum, lacks flavor. I loved the fried rice that came with the fried chicken. Rice was cooked al dente as well. The chicken was crisp, but I would not be craving for it. 

Place was clean and staff were polite. 

Overall, not the best thai place but it was decent.
Best thai restaurant I've been in vegas! Yellow, red and pineapple curry is THE best here. Tom yum is also the best here. I'm telling you, hands down the best affordable thai restaurant in town.

The kitchen here is so fast and the prices are so good that you almost expect the food to be sub-par, but it's not. The food is good.

Pot Sticker Appetizer 5/5
Crispy and delicious, topped with sushi-like sauces and fresh spring onions. Highly recommended. 

Green Papaya Salad 5/5
Fresh shredded green papaya, tomatoes,  cabbage on the side. Spicy fish sauce dressing is awesome, but maybe a bit hot for some. Ask for mild if you're not a big fan of heat.

Pad Thai with Chicken 5/5
Perfectly cooked al dente noodles, fresh crispy bean sprouts, delicious pad thai sauce, juicy chicken.

Very impressed with everything here, especially for the price. Will be back for more!

Hit and Miss. Too much of a hit and miss though.
When it comes to food, It being great when it is great is not enough to overcome the times it's not by the food tasting as if it isn't cooked enough or has gone slightly bad or old.

For the most part when I've been here the Pad Tai is great and the soups are good too. But a few times iv'e gotten Pad Tai where the meat tasted as if it, as I said was not cooked enough or had started going bad or old. I got shrimp Pad Tai once, tasted very fishy. So I thought i'll just stay away from the shrimp, then one of the chicken Pad Tai's I got tasted the same way.. little old or uncooked. So I probably will stay away from here for some time and hopefully it gets better when I come back or try again.

Also the service is.. nice but casual.

I've been to this business twice.  The most recent time I ordered chicken satay to go.  It was very good, but not my favorite.  The recipe and preparation is slightly different than my preferred satay, but it is still good.  A small peanut sauce and cucumber salad is part of the satay order and they are tasty as well.  It is in the same shopping center as a grocery store I frequent which makes it convenient, but it's not my first choice for Thai food.  The staff were pleasant and went  back to check on my order a couple of times.  The satay order was presented to me hot wrapped in aluminum foil.

This place will only ever be eaten by me again.....oh wait never. Their tom kha has canned mushrooms and huge chunks of tomato. Wtf. I ordered pad kee Mao which I don't even know what they call it here but it was pretty much all cabagge and carrots with like a small sprinkling of noodles. Double wtf. You can tell these people are cutting corners and it is affecting the quality of their food. I won't give it one star cause it wasn't roach infested and for some people who have NO idea what good thai food is would possibly dine here, but for me it's a no go.

So, I'm an idiot but I read the delivery as $15 and it's free. I'm putting it out there so other folks don't do what I did and ordered $15 or more then expected free delivery only to get charged $4 for something I could've picked up myself.

Ugh. My bad on expectation and also communicating with them when I ordered if I had made the delivery.

Just explicitly putting it out there. They don't don't do free delivery. 

Food and price is decent.

RUN, DON'T WALK from this truly terrible neighborhood Thai restaurant.

Just about the worst service I've ever had in Las Vegas. 

Each person in our party of six ordered their own food individually. 

It was NOT a family-style or shared or buffet style order. 

Yet they brought out the dishes one by one, with each plate brought out several minutes after the last, So no one could eat at the same time.

They also did not bring out any silverware or extra plates for people who'd not yet been served, so it was impossible for people who'd been served to share with people still waiting for food.

They forgot about my order entirely. 

After being reminded twice to bring out my food, it finally arrived after everyone else had finished about half their meal.

So I ended up having to take most of my meal home, because others were done eating well before me.

To add insult injury, they then took it upon themselves to add an 18% tip to the bill, but then hid this from me by bringing me a credit card slip with a blank for a tip, obviously hoping to get tipped twice.

When we complained that the horrible service did not justify an 18% tip, they refused to lower it or remove it, claiming that they impose a mandatory 18% tip on groups of six.

The food is strictly ho-hum, mediocre, middle of the road. Nothing special about the food. 

I don't judge a restaurant by the decor, but the decor in this place is truly hideous, chaotic and disconnected. There's nothing even remotely Asian (or, for that matter, tasteful) about the decor.

For a better and more authentic Thai experience in the neighborhood, with excellent service, excellent food and beautiful decor, go instead to Pin Kaow on W. Lake Mead Blvd. and rainbow Boulevard

Used to be better, now every time when I come to this place again, I find the portion to be smaller, taste blander and with less veggies-to-noodles/rice ratio. Makes me remember why I don't frequent this place anymore, even though I used to like it a lot before, and to some extend, still feel the same way about their main china town location and the one on jones.

I wish this place was closer to me! Joel and I were on this side of town for his work and I used my trusty Yelp app to find a place to have lunch. I've been on a major Thai kick for a while so this place was right up my alley. 

The decor you can tell is trying to be fancy, but the diamond buttons on the inside of the chairs are a bit much. I did like the trees painted on the walls with birds. 

The service was swift and on point. They even offered me a to go cup for my Thai Iced Tea. 

The Noodle House has excellent lunch specials! Which we totally took advantage of. You can choose from one or two items from their menu. On this visit I ordered the Red Curry with Pork. Joel had the Orange Chicken and Beef with Broccoli. Our meals came with egg drop soup and an egg roll. The egg drop soup was really tasty. I had to stop myself from filling up on the soup it was so good. Plus, it didn't have that fake yellow color egg drop soup always has. My Red Curry was delicious. The pork was tender and the Curry itself had the perfect coconut milk flavor coupled with a great spice that wasn't overwhelming. The egg roll was crisp and full of veggies. Joel's Orange Chicken was also seriously tasty. It's normally not my thing, but it was so tender and not overly sweet. I kept sneaking bites of his chicken. Joel's Beef and Broccoli was also very tender and had great flavor. 

I wish this place was on my side of town. The price was awesome, but the food was even better!! What a great find on a side of town I rarely visit!

This place has reasonable prices. They have a large selection of food here. The Satay Chicken is very dry. It was difficult to eat. I liked the Pineapple Fried rice . I had 3 helpings of it. Their Thai Tea is pretty sweet. The Phat Thai was good too. Their Green Curry Paste Fried Rice was really spicy.

Just had dinner here! We started with the potstickers which were awesome. We got the chicken pad Thai and spicy flat noodles for our entrees! The food is just awesome! They are very busy service at first lacked a bit but our food came out quickly and our bill was only $21!! Can't beat that! We will definately be back!
Good soup, if I am stranded in summerlin I know exactly where to go if I want a Thai version of Pho.

The food here is inexpensive and decent quality. I come here often and every time is a different experience. The food is great and fast but the only complaint is their service. The customer service is very poor and they should definitely work on it.

I only gave three stars because they were pretty stingy with the meat. The dishes were deceiving, you wont realize how little meat it had until you start digging in. Would rather spend my money on Pin Kaow which is only a couple of blocks away.

I am completely disappointed in my visit here. I live right around the corner and dine in or order delivery weekly for the past year. I order the same exact dish every time I come in. Tonight, as usual I get the panang avocado curry with shrimp. The flavor was the same as usual, yet the avocados were black and hard. I was disgusted. When I told them about it she basically shrugged it off and said what it's not suppose to be like that? Of course not! 

The way they handled it was very unprofessional. All I wanted was some acknowledgement that they did something wrong and should not be serving food like that. I still paid the full bill and tip $10 on a $30 tab as usall. I wasnt expecting any discounts. But the way they handle the situation was totally wrong. And now they just lost a good customer.

We were surprised that this one was cute compared to the more hole in the wall original location. 

The BF and I shared the pineapple curry with shrimp. The curry was red curry coconut base which was decent. It was a bit too tangy for me, but it was well made and had a good amount in shrimp, pineapple and veggies in it. It comes with just a cup of rice, we had to ask for another cup, which is extra per cup. 

Spicy Thai noodles - think of it similar to pad se ew, but with other veggies like cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, onions in it. It wasn't very spicy though. In fact, they didn't ask us about our spice level at all, but maybe then they assumed to go mild. I should probably ask next time. 

For the portions, these were cheap... a few dollars less than the average going rate. The flavor I thought was decent. I don't know what it was about it, but I rarely get heartburn and did. It was odd is all. 

Service was just OK. We came an hour before their closing (20 minutes before closing is kitchen last call) and when we entered they kinda seemed a bit bummed we showed. They weren't the most attentive given we were the only ones there, but there were take out orders coming through still. I had to walk up to get my bill since the 3 people in the front were all busy doing something. The food came out lightening fast which was a plus, but also was maybe so we can get done fast. 

I was confused how this place didn't have a bathroom, but I thought sitting there how weird that was. I did see on some peoples reviews there IS a bathroom. You just have to walk to it on the side or something. 

There's several items on the menu that is unique to them, combined with a great pricepoint that makes it a good cheap option that's in a convenient of a area for us. I'm sure we will be back for more bites.

Satay chicken is excellent. Shrimp wrap deep fried (appetizer) is good, skin a bit thick to my liking.  Other appetizers are average. Crab Rangoon not my deal.  Pad See Eu is very tasty.  Spicy Thai Noodle is good, 5-level spicy is a bit much for me. I'd go 3 spicy if you're not used to Thai spicy food. They take their spicy food very seriously, I will do a 3 next time for my self.

I've bumped up a star because their curry is delightful and has only gotten better. 

Only downside - 

They still offer delivery, but the last few times I've called, they don't want to deliver. I said I would wait and hour...even close to two. They still are very rude about it on the phone. I had a lady say 3 times that it would be a wait, and I said each time it was fine.  She then proceeded to sigh into the phone like she was pissed. I said, "Can I really not do delivery? I can't come in...but, I'm willing to wait."

If you don't want to deliver and you don't have time, say, "We cannot deliver right now."

Geeeeeeeeez.

4 stars for the food...5 stars for the value and "bang for your buck!"

Came here for an impromptu lunch and ordered take out.

She got the Thai Beef Salad (Phone pic):

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thai-style-noodle-house-las-vegas-4?select=uVyr7IuBmjyR04VMs0Gpow#uVyr7IuBmjyR04VMs0Gpow

Which is served cold, marinated with lots of flavors here!  Huge portions and low prices...I think this was only $6-7??  Not my most favorite version I've tried, but it was good!

I went with my favorite dish as always, the Pad Kee Mao aka Drunken Noodles (Phone Pic):

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thai-style-noodle-house-las-vegas-4?select=VeZSixXFxYJjsa2y10mYdA#VeZSixXFxYJjsa2y10mYdA

It was good...definitely have had better, but the taste is there, spice is hot, and portions are large and very fair at again, only $7 or so?  Probably the cheapest I've ever paid for this dish, and one of the largest portions.  Also, they aren't afraid to make it hot!  This 10/10 Thai Spicy was very close to accurate in my book!

To me, this is probably the best bang for your buck Thai I've ran into so far.  The portions are fair, prices are cheap, and the to-go order was ready right on the dot, so grabbing for a speedy lunch is a safe bet!  

Glad I don't work down the street lol

My husband is Thai and we tend to eat at Thai restaurants often. This is our regular place. It's one of the closest thai places to our home and the food is good. The portions are a good size as well. We are a family of 6 so portion size is important to us. We can eat here for less than most restaurants (including several fast food choices).

I'm a fan of their "Pick Two" lunch option for $7 and change, and this location doesn't try to hide the lunch specials from you! Your options are extensive and include all of their curries, unlike some Thai spots that really limit what they offer on lunch special. It comes with soup, rice and a fried treat, and the two picks are served in a nice sized dish. I think flavor-wise they are really consistent with the original location, and this location is definitely up the scale on the fancy factor- white chairs, tile on the wall, was that a chandelier? Although, it is odd you have to go outside to go to the bathroom.

I selected the mint chicken and green curry for my two. The chicken is minced, and the flavor was nice, but I probably wouldn't order it again. I realized I am out of Thai Style practice because I didn't remember the green curry coming with a mountain of bamboo shoots. I am not a fan of bamboo shoots, but the curry still had a fabulous flavor. Next time, I have to remember to order it with vegetables, hold the shoots. And, next time, maybe I will go double curry.

We recently discover the Noodle House. We have eaten there 3 times and yet to be disappointed. Everything is always cooked fresh and served quickly. I highly recommend the orange chicken and the egg rolls. The servers are very friendly and helpful. It has become our favorite restaurant. The only real negative comment I can make is that the service is horrible.
Best take out Thai food since moving to LV one year ago; best Asian food take out since arriving in LV too!
Must try the Green Curry with avocado and salmon.  Excellent dish and good service.  Prices are very reasonable as well.

So I tried the Won-ton Soup ($6.75) and it was unique. It had a unusual fishy flavor and was notably spicy. I ordered the soup in hopes it would sooth my sore throat, but instead it gave me an unexpected punch of spicy and fishy. It was not necessary the flavor I was hoping I would get. 

I have determined my favorite item on this menu is the #38 - Khua-Kai Rice Noodle ($7.25). This dish consists of wide rice noodles wok-fried with chicken breast, egg, and bean sprouts. I prefer to substitute the chicken for fried tofu. Any time I come to this restaurant I order a #38 and the N.H. Style Pot Stickers. 

----------------------------------------

Order your food ahead of time if you want to take it home because you do have a short wait time. The food is pretty amazing. They have really good Pad Thai here! Their N.H. Style Pot Stickers  are $5.75 and totally worth it. Will absolutely return again!

So good! The Tum Yum Soup with chicken ordered with mild spice is absolutely delicious! This restaurant has excellent orange chicken, chicken satay, fried rice, and most of all, the mango with sticky rice. I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I really hate rating a restaurant based on service alone because the food here is good, but....

Ok this is review is a 3 Star ONLY because of the employees and the service. This is my third time coming in here and this place does serve good food! 

1st visit: I ordered their BBQ Pork and Chinese Sausage combo fried rice, but they told me they ran out of Chinese Sausage. It's 11:30 and they opened at 11:00.

2nd visit: I ordered the same thing and instead they gave me BBQ Pork with Fried Rice. Not what I ordered, but it was good. 

3rd time I visit and I ordered the same thing again hoping that I finally get to eat what I've been trying to order the first time. I ordered my food and 45 MINUTES LATER my food came out!!! I've NEVER waited that long for my food!

Lazy night, don't want to cook? Order neighborhood Thai. For pick up only!

After reading other reviews, the restaurant should remove the delivery options. Haven't they heard of yelp? Stop making excuses and stop offering delivery. It feels like you, as a patron, are losing a service that ought to be offered. However, if you just knew from the start you couldn't get delivery, it wouldn't be that big of a deal. 

Onto the positive... I like how your orders are saved under your phone number. We get the standard, safe dishes like panang curry, pad see ew, tom yum soup. We've tried the basil chicken, drunken noodles, and papaya salad. Of those three, I would only order the drunken noodles again. There are much better basil chickens and papaya salads elsewhere.

This is my to go place whenever I crave Thai food. Especially the Panang Curry, the spices and coconut based sauced is seasoned just right and pairs well with rice. Another dish I enjoy is the Pad See Ew, flat rice noodle with a soy sauce based flavor and Chinese broccoli and the option of protein or tofu. A great option from the popular Pad Thai that most people are accustomed to.

My only complaint I have is the customer service. At times the service is great and other times it's been lacking. A few times we have been ignored or the order is wrong. The management needs to take the initiative to communicate the entire staff on how to handle customer service. I have a few friends and neighbors complained that the posted time doesn't correlate to the actual operating hours. I still remember we were turn down at 9:28pm and the posted time was 10:00pm. The staff member on duty told us that the kitchen is closed. This is very misleading to the public and doesn't reflect a professional business practice. I recommend that you call ahead if you plan to arrive later in the evening. Overall, delicious Thai food at a reasonable price point!

2017 Yelp Review #84

This is my go to place everytime I think of Thai food!
Great food! Excellent service! And awesome pricing!
Must try place for everyone!

My friend and I picked up food from the Rampart location today and we thought the woman doing the take-out food was quite rude. When getting the food home we noticed that the crab rangoons did not have a bit of crab in any of them. We paid $8 for cream cheese filled pastrys that were not that great. The Thai curry saved the meal. It was the right amount of spicy, chicken was tender and delicious, and veggies the perfect softness. The chicken pad Thai was okay, but my friend told me it's not as good as The brown rice Thai kitchen. All in all, this place is okay, but didnt blow us away. We may order from here again because the price was right and the chicken curry was good, but we won't be ordering the "crab" Rangoons again. The reason I didn't give it 4 stars was do to the service and crab rangoons. If we have a better experience next time I may change my rating.

I'm glad we tried this place. My hubby ordered BBQ pork fried rice which was sooo delicious, I had the Tom Yum which was so delicious too hot and perfect flavor.  Place was clean and we experienced great fast friendly service and the Thai tea is soo good too.  I recommend this place for lunch very affordable.

This is one of my most visited Thai restaurants in Vegas for multiple reasons. The food is great for a really reasonable price. I think their Panang curry is super flavorful and that goes for vegetarian and meat added as well. I love their spicy basil leaf tofu, pineapple fried rice, and the pad thai and pad see ew -- which are pretty standard. I also really like their papaya salad + Thai beef jerky--probably the most winning items I have tried on their menu. It's got the right amount of spice and crisp on the edges, and the papaya salad compliments it well. I could go on and on because their selection is great and everything I have tried has not disappointed. 

This location has a good amount of seating and is cute and spacious inside. One thing to note is that it takes a bit longer for food to come out, so not so great if you are in a rush.

I'm so happy that I discovered this place!!  It's going to be my new go-to spot that's just around the corner from my house!  I think this place is pretty new, because I haven't noticed it until recently.  Excellent food quality & prices.  The service is fast & friendly.  The location is very small, but extremely clean and very pretty inside.  Most of the soups are $6.50 - 7.  

I tried the pork & fish ball soup because of another yelper's recommendation, and I was not disappointed!  I love that they offer 4 different choices of noodles, as I opted for the flat rice noodle.  Other noodle choices include: egg, vermicilli, or thin rice noodle.  Be careful with the little spice rack they bring out, as a little spice goes a long way.  Without meaning to, I overspiced my soup a bit, but it was still wonderful.  I just ended up drinking a lot of water and nursing my runny nose while enjoying my soup.  On my next visit, which will be very soon, I plan to try the Tom Yum soup.  Honestly, everything on the menu sounds great, which offers a full array of Thai dishes in addition to the soup.  They do take out orders, but I'm not sure if they offer delivery.

Food was awesome! Just wish the waitress woulda given me more then just one cup of water during my meal. Seriously need to have a chat with their waitresses about customer service and how to check on customers i got a water before my meal and no refill untill she brought me a to go box. I have been a waiter before so i know first hand keeping up with drinks is the easiest part of the job, if you can't do that then get out of the food service buisness for reals!

We had the spring rolls,  yellow curry,  and Thai spicy noodle.  
All Delish.  
They were wonderful to make everything vegan for us. 
The price is also fantastic,  20$ for two of us to eat and we are very full.  
Service was fast. 

If your looking for a fancy date night this is not your place,  but a quick dinner our or take out this is the place. 

Spice ranges from 1 to 10 we opted for 7 which is leaving our mouths burning after our meal is done. 

We will visit again.

Not the first time I've been here. I order the same thing every time and this time it has become difficult to order.
My experience this time has left me less than thrilled as a returning customer to never return. 

I ordered drunken noodles
Pad Thai
Beef salad
Crab rangoon 
Combo fried rice
Side of Chinese broccoli tossed in a garlic sauce.

Apparently they want to charge you for a crispy pork but give you no pork and just the broccoli and rice with sauce for $8.50 when the steamed broccoli is $3.50?? So just so you understand the sauce costs more than the vegetable itself.. I don't want rice broccoli and sauce; simply wanted a side of veggie tossed in a sauce that's its, but that's not possible said the "chef".

Friendly Staff.  Just expanded to the suite next door so now it is twice as big.  Still only about 15 tables.  Enjoy going there and doing take out as well.  I seem to order the Seafood Pad Thai almost all the time.  I have never been disappointed.  My wife loves the soups.  Good food at great prices.  Quality is consistant as the service.

I've tried all 3 locations and this location wins best decor.  The food is pretty much the same at all locations with the two outside of Chinatown being newer and cleaner in appearance.  Thai Style is my favorite Thai spot outside of the pricier Lotus of Siam.  I think the options are a better value than say Archie's for the typical Thai fare, with some options you might not see at some of the more generic Thai restaurants. Some of my favorite dishes are the beef/pork jerky with this amazing sweet/salty/sour dipping sauce.  The Moo Tod (fried pork) over fried rice is also delicious, with the pork being fried with a hint of sweetness.  The pork comes over a heaping portion of fried rice.  It also comes with a bland soup...which I generally don't partake in...but I'm told it's a palette cleanser.   My new favorite find has been the Three Companion Pork, which comes with sticky rice, papaya salad, and either pork or chicken.  The papaya salad here is a refreshing option for the Las Vegas summer heat.  It's a blend of green papaya, tomatoes, green beans, and carrots sprinkled with peanuts.  It's a bit spicy even when I ordered it at a level 2 out of 10.  My nose was getting runny while eating it, but I kept going back for more until the dish was empty.  I like that Thai Style also offers duck as an option instead of just chicken/beef/pork.  The duck fried rice and duck pad see ew are delicious.  In the wintertime, I also enjoy the beef noodle soup.  The broth is a dark, thick broth with a variety of beef cuts and beef meat balls.  Most items are $7-9 for a large portion.

Been to so many Thai restaurants.. This one has a very unique taste to their food.

Curry, not so over bearing & everything was great. Place may need a touch up here and there but its a good size and its clean. # 4 on the papaya salad was a little too spicy but many choices within$6-$12/ dish.. Thats a treat! A gem in Summerlin.

We still love coming here as our Thursday ritual after the kids are done with their activities. Mainly, it's a 2 minute drive from where we are coming from and by this point we needs-ta-eat. It's not fancy, not grimey...perfect dining setting for our party of 6. We never ever have to wait for a table here especially because of our party size so that's another reason why eating here has become our ritual. While I still love their food and price point...I will have to say we have clearly seen a slight change in their food. My husband has been ordering the spicy Thai noodle (fat noodles) the past few times in a row because he lies to think what he is getting served was just an off night. Safe to say that isn't the case. He's been griping about why he doesn't get baby corn in it. Lol. The past 2 times he's poked his fork around in disgust because he notice that the veggie-to-noodle ratio is well, damnt...I such at math. Why did I even bust the ratio word out. Hahahha. Okay seriously though, his dish looks more like a stir fried vegetable plate rather than a noodle dish with vegetables. 

We ALWAYS order the Thai fried rice and I swear the past several times its either lacked in flavor and/or on the oily side!! They used to serve it all nice to us...throwing coriander leaves on there, etc...but the serving size looks like it has reduced and no more pretty garnishments. Honestly, those garnishments whether it was a part of the dish or truely meant to be a garnish helped made the dish taste even better. 

My beef soup I would order used to have fried garlic sprinkled, enough bean sprouts and baby bok choy to make me feel veggie satisfied...but again, it's like they're skimping us short. Havent had the garlic in it in awhile, sometomes i dont even think there are any bean sprouts, and the flavor has definitely lack as well. We come here weekly for the past few years so we would know for a fact if they have started to change up ways. Considering we have been coming here for a few years and only of late have we noticed a change...I wonder if they have a new cook, on a budget cut, etc...

Bummer. I loathe when that happens. Anyway, we will still be coming in until we seriously have had enough and get fed up. Even with those new gripes, I'd still recommend giving them a shot.
Lunch specials looked good but orange chicken was 75% batter. Maybe 2 ounces of meat. Egg drop soup tasteless. The staff was very cold and not friendly. Food was just okay.

So I used to go here a lot

1- because it is close to work
2- it has decent authentic Thai cooking
3- reasonably priced lunch menu

 today.. I decided to order for delivery. I called at 11 (right when they opened), ordered my food, and the lady said there was going to a $2 charge for delivery because they charge $1 per mile. I don't mind paying it but across the street is not 2 miles, Google maps says the place is 0.4 miles. Then on top of that they said it would take 45 mins for the food. Why? You just opened.. It takes about 10-15 to cook it, and its only 5 min drive to the office. 

Instead of convenience, I'm now going to make the drive down the street to another restaurant.

I eat Thai food pretty often, we were looking for a new place to try and decided on this one for its great reviews. First off the person answering the phone for pickup barely spoke English and didn't understand us trying to order a pick up. Then they said it would be 15-20 minutes and when we headed over at that Time we still had to wait. The food wasn't even ready.  After another 15 minutes it's ready so we left. When we got home to eat the food mine was not great- I had the pad see ew. The noodes felt like a plastic material and the sauce  was off. I personally wouldnt eat here again even I just for that reason. 

It's also in an awkward location so unless you live next door don't bother making the trip. It's pretty north west a random parking lot in the corner. You probably need to know where you are headed as well.

3.7 I was really looking for a great Thai place on our new area, this is a maybe. The prices are pretty cheap on the menu, but the sizes are pretty small. We go to another place on the other side of town that is about $1 higher but you get 1/2 a portion more. 
The flavors were pretty good. I think the best deal of all we ordered is the seafood wonton, $9.70 huge bowl loaded with seafood, noodles, wontons and veggies.
We left hungry, not a good thing. 
As I read reviews from 5 months ago I wonder if the new remodel have anything to do with portion size. Because they are not big by any means.

Their food is SO GOOD! specially for the price!! I always get the pad thai and the coconut soup with the shrimp in it. All other items I've tried have been great too. The service is extraordinary. I think the owners run this place. Love coming to this place :)

Luckily most Thai food in Vegas is good to excellent and this Thai style noodle house is decent but could step it up a bit by, for example, using better quality jasmine rice and sprucing up the decor - seats and tables are flimsy. For a quick fix or take-out, you could do worse, but with all the competition around (5 other Thai restaurants within a 2 mile radius) it's hard to argue that this particular spot will keep me going back.

The lunch specials have a choice of 1 or 2 entre choices. $5.95 For one choice or $7.95 for 2 dishes. I had the Mongolian beef and the cashew nut chicken. It was ok. Nothing special. I have had a lot better. The Mongolian beef was really tough. Very low quality meat. The cashew nut chicken was bland. It had about 5 nuts. I may go there again as I always give two chances to get it right. But with that said I will not make a special effort to do so. 
The service was not good. I had to keep asking for a refill of my ice tea. It was not busy and my waiter was just standing around. 
The prices were good. It is the only reason I have them 3 stars.

It is hit and miss at this restaurant.  While the Chef specials are good, the appetizers and soups leave something to be desired.  Thai food is better than its Chinese food unless you're choosing take out.  Gr8 menu selection and efficient service.  Casual atmosphere and  decor.  Good value in Summerlin for some fast Thai food.  I like the ginger steamed snapper spiced half spiced and the salmon dishes.

They have such amazing food! I haven't had anything I dislike there. And they always greet us and the kids, since we go there so often. The soup, beef jerky.. I recommend. The orange chicken is out of this world for a kids meals.  The curry chicken, spicy but I eat it every time. Cleans out my sinuses but well worth it

Unfortunately the portions have gotten so small it's not worth the money coming here anymore.. used to come here all the time but they've cut back on portions ... barely any meat in the dishes and the lunch special is so small I'd rather pay 2 dollars more at Archie's and get a MEAL than a couple bites... very disappointed since this was one of my favorites.. will not be returning.
